Providing analytical support to DPD and PD (Process Development) activities by ensuring consistent and timely execution of standardized platform product characterization assays, including data review, storage and trending. Integrating new program products into uniQure analytical platforms, to ensure timely progress of transfer and regulatory filing efforts.  The Jr Scientist reports to the Analytical Development Senior Scientist /Team Lead.  Key result areas (major duties, accountabilities and responsibilities)  Design experimental plans underlining development, qualification, transfer and troubleshooting of assays, introduction of new analytical technologies, or relevant to CMC activities or regulatory filing (e.g. extended characterization, early ref materials, etc.). Executes experiments and prepare data overviews and reports, including interpretation of results. Suggest next steps in experimental design including rationale for suggestions. Drafts and reviews laboratory and technical documentation relevant to assay execution (Electronic Lab Notes, SOPs), assay development, qualification, transfer, troubleshooting or other PAD relevant studies (protocols, reports, position papers and memos) Coordinates activities to be executed with technicians support within the team, assist technicians with their planning and coordination of daily activities Communicates and aligns with internal stakeholders on activities relevant to specific projects progression. Train technicians, QC analysts or other players as part of the technology transfer and qualification activities Responsible for development, qualification and transfer activities within a project (including execution and writing protocols and reports) Ensure all laboratory activities are performed according to applicable protocols, and follow safety and quality procedures to ensure a safe working environment and high data quality Improvement of skills and knowledge necessary to successfully support assigned tasks and projects through training and independently. Continuously improve and update her/his area of expertise. Provide improvement suggestions and support the improvement implementation.  Qualifications & Skills  Minimum of MSc with 4-6 years of experience or PhD in a Life Sciences-related field (biochemistry, molecular biology, biotechnology) Extensive knowledge and hands on experience with aseptic cell culture techniques (e.g. insect and human cells) Extensive knowledge and hands on experience with relevant molecular biology techniques (e.g. (q)PCR, DNA electrophoresis) Extensive knowledge and hands on experience with biochemical analyses (e.g. protein electrophoresis, western blotting, ELISA) Experience in assay design, assay development and trouble shooting Experience in product characterization studies is a plus Experience in viral vaccines or gene therapy is a plus Working experience in a regulated setting (GxP), technical documentation writing (SOP, Protocols, Reports), and awareness of GxP pharmaceutical regulations is a plus Computer software skills including Microsoft Office Strong interpersonal and communication skills in English, written and verbal including presentation of technically complex data  Core competencies  Detail oriented: strong analytical skills, high level of understanding of assay principles, ability to critically analyze and present complex data sets Thorough: ability to set up and carry out tasks with an eye for completeness (e.g. results achieved according to self-prepared protocols, results compiled in clear overview and proposal for follow up experiments) Analytical Thinking and Problem Solving: signals problems, recognizes important information, traces possible causes of problems, thinks about and implements new working methods or new applications, brings forward and implements original solutions for problems related to the department and function Planning and organizing: ability to plan own and other’s work to achieve results in a timely way while ensuring the highest standard of quality, discuss with others to align planning of multiple complex activities simultaneously, scheduling activities with technicians within the team and help team members with their planning Co-operative: ability and drive to work within an interdisciplinary team, good written and spoken communication skills, ability to communicate and align with internal stakeholders, ability and willingness to work in a fast-paced environment. Self-aware. Soft Skills: dependable, proactive, motivated, flexible

title: Treasury and Insurance Analyst (part-time)
description: We are currently looking for a part time permanent position (estimated 20 hours a week) to be based in Wageningen in our Expert Treasury and Insurance department in the Global Finance and Procurement division. The position is to be filled as soon as possible.  The position will be working alongside the Global Credit Manager, as well as the Treasury and Insurance Experts to support Treasury, Insurance and Credit Management responsibilities. The role is also expected to support other Finance activities for KWS International Holdings BV.  Your tasks: Support Global Credit Manager in providing advice, direction and oversight of Credit Management activities for the KWS Group and its subsidiary entities. Makes recommendations on financing solutions that would minimize the cost of credit and maximize cash collection, all of which should positively impact cash flow and working capital. Main point of contact for credit insurance company (where there is insurance in place this in place), all the while ensuring credit limits and insurance and up-to-date according to information given to KWS by the credit insurer in close cooperation with Expert Insurance. Collect and report risk and exposure data to insurers. Manage insurance invoices. Where required, provide support as necessary to the Expert Hub Treasury and Insurance team, in particular executing Treasury activities for and on behalf of KWS International Holdings BV. This includes daily cash management, currency hedging, monitoring various intercompany financing, guarantees issuance, commercial papers, syndicated loans and capital market transactions. Performing finance activities of KWS International Holdings BV which will include reviewing, monitoring and proposing dividend flows, together with Business Partner Finance and Expert Treasury. Your profile: Preferably academic degree in Economics/Business/Accounting At least 5 years of experience in Finance, ideally some experience in Insurance, Treasury and Credit Management. Fluent in English and German (written and spoken) Experience in relevant IT systems (MS Office and SAP). Knowledge of SAP is desirable. Communication and stakeholder management skills Analytical skills, solution oriented and able to work successfully in complex organization Accurate and reliable Working independently, structured and well organized, able to work under pressure and convince through organizational strength. Cooperative and team-working mindset   Presentatie KWS KWS is een van 's werelds toonaangevende plantenveredelingsbedrijven. Met de traditie van familiebezit, opereert KWS al meer dan 160 jaar onafhankelijk. Het richt zich op plantenveredeling en de productie en verkoop van zaaizaad voor maïs, suikerbieten, granen, aardappelen, raapzaad, zonnebloemen en groenten. KWS maakt gebruik van geavanceerde plantveredelingsmethoden. 5.700 medewerkers vertegenwoordigen KWS in meer dan 70 landen. Voor meer informatie: www.kws.com/career. Volg ons op LinkedIn® op https://linkedin.com/company/kwsgroup/.  Ons privacybeleid voor kandidaten is beschikbaar op www.kws.com/dataprotection. Selecteer het land waar de vacature die u heeft gesolliciteerd is geplaatst en, indien van toepassing, de specifieke business unit.

title: Sustainable Finance Corporates Analyst
description: Join us as a Sustainable Finance Corporates Analyst We’re looking for someone with a passion for sustainable finance to take on a key role in NatWest Markets You’ll be supporting the sustainable finance origination effort through creating presentation and analytical materials, covering both market developments and implications for our clients You’ll receive excellent exposure as you cover segments such as financing, cash investment and risk management transactions for our corporate clients What you'll do As a Sustainable Finance Corporates Analyst, you’ll be working to meet your team's and personal objectives set across multiple dimensions including Customer, Financial & Business Delivery, Risk & Control, and People. Your key responsibilities will be: Working on a variety of sustainability data structuring and analysis projects, both for management reporting and client materials Helping to produce educational materials concerning sustainable finance Working with bank-wide teams and other franchises to multiply the reach and scope of ESG and sustainable finance The skills you'll need To join us in this role, you’ll need a passion for sustainable finance and sustainability in general, coupled with good commercial awareness and acumen. You’ll also need: Strong communication and presentation skills The ability to balance a variety of different tasks in a faced paced environment Good team working skills and a highly collaborative approach to your work

title: Senior Specialist – Data Architect (AD7), within the ICT Department of Europol
description: ABOUT EUROPOL This selection procedure is intended to establish a reserve list of successful candidates (indicative number is 3). Europol may retain the right to make use of the reserve list to select candidates for similar posts, should business needs require so. Europol is a well-established and recognized organisation that became an EU agency in 2010. It is constantly looking for creative, self-reliant and energetic employees, who are up to the challenges involved in international crime-fighting, to work in its state-of-the-art headquarters in The Hague, the Netherlands. Europol employs more than 1,000 personnel, including around 160 analysts, to identify and track the most dangerous criminal and terrorist networks in Europe. Our people come from a variety of professional backgrounds such as law enforcement, finance, legal, information technologies, human resources, communication, etc. Working in close-knit teams, our specialists use their expertise and our cutting-edge technology to support investigations into serious organised crime and terrorism within and outside the EU. A solid track record Europol has: disrupted many criminal and terrorist networks; contributed to the arrest of thousands of dangerous criminals; helped recover millions of euros of crime proceeds; helped hundreds of victims of trafficking and abuse, including children. The working environment at Europol has a lot to offer. It is: highly collaborative; intellectually stimulating; multilingual; multidisciplinary; international. Prospective candidates should be prepared to work in a dynamic and fast-moving environment that requires a high level of flexibility, and should have the ability to perform well within a team. Equal opportunity Europol is an equal opportunities employer and encourages applications without distinction on the basis of gender, colour, racial, ethnic or social origin, genetic features, language, religion or belief, political or any other opinion, membership of a national minority, property, birth, disability, nationality, age, sexual orientation or gender identity. We aim to create and maintain a healthy and attractive work environment that supports our colleagues in their career planning and in achieving a healthy work-life balance. Employment at Europol is open to nationals of EU Member States. There is no nationality quota system in operation, but Europol is striving for a broad range of nationalities in order to keep a well-balanced geographical distribution among its staff members. BACKGROUND, MAIN PURPOSE AND TASKS OF THE POST The ICT Department is in the forefront of technology innovation with the responsibility for devising, delivering and operating modern ICT capabilities supporting the core mission and support processes of Europol. Over 150 internal staff members and a significant number of domain-specific consultants are responsible for devising, developing, delivering and operating information management and communication technology capabilities that ensure enhanced criminal information analysis exchange among Europol, Member States and third parties. The selected candidate will work in a team of solution architects and engineers, each one predominantly focused in the specific architecture domain area for which they are most competent, but all closely cooperating as a team, coordinated by a Senior Specialist who reports to the Head of ICT Unit. The selected candidate will cooperate closely with other software, security engineering and operations teams, providing hands-on architecture guidance and contributing to solution engineering, technical product management and system administration in the area of competence. The successful applicant will have to carry out the following generic duties: Liaise with and monitor the market to keep abreast of the technology curve in fast evolving domains, with a special focus on data and information architectures; Translate business requirements into innovative solutions architecture and designs, producing baseline and target solution architecture documentation, and their respective roadmaps aligned with the business strategy on one side and with the overall ICT evolution on the other side; Liaise with key stakeholders to support planning and execution of ICT changes and development initiatives; Assume quality assurance roles in ICT development projects; As needed, act as Technical Product Manager of selected systems and platforms, taking responsibility for the ICT product throughout its life cycle; Monitor and/or participate to selected EU, law enforcement, or other relevant forums, and sponsor internal adoption of interfaces and standards supporting the delivery and support of decentralised solutions. Related to his or her specific area of competence, (s)he will: Produce, maintain, update, disseminate and expand the set of architecture standards, guidelines and reference architectures for the implementation and support of ICT solutions, with a special focus on data and information processing systems; Identify and specify ICT architecture components required to enable the delivery of the designed solutions, providing guidance and review for their implementation and configuration, with as much detail as needed; Participate in solution engineering and system administration activities, in cooperation with software, infrastructure and operations teams; Drive the evaluation and selection of the technical products that are required to implement ICT solutions, with a special focus on data and information processing systems; Assess business cases, project proposals, and project deliverables, to determine feasibility, impact on, and compliance with, the overall ICT architecture and landscape. REQUIREMENTS - ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA a. Candidates must Be a national of one of the Member States of the European Union and enjoy full rights as a citizen Have fulfilled any obligations imposed by the applicable laws on military service; Produce appropriate character references as to his or her suitability for the performance of the duties Be physically fit to perform the duties pertaining to the position (prior to appointment the successful candidate will be medically examined by one of the institution’s medical officers in order that the institution may be satisfied that the candidate fulfils the requirements of Art 12(2)(d) CEOS) Produce evidence of a thorough knowledge of one of the languages of the Union and a satisfactory knowledge of another language of the Union to the extent necessary for the performance of the duties b. Candidates must have A level of education which corresponds to completed university studies, preferably in Computer Science or Information Technology, attested by a diploma when the normal period of university education is at least 4 years OR A level of education, which corresponds to completed university studies, preferably in Computer Science or Information Technology, attested by a diploma and appropriate professional experience of at least 1 year when the normal period of university education is 3 years OR Professional training of an equivalent level in a relevant area (e.g. Police Officer’s School) and after having completed the training, at least the number of years of relevant professional experience indicated in the table below: Duration of professional training Additional professional experience required for equivalency More than 6 months and up to 1 year 4 years More than 1 year and up to 2 years 3 years More than 2 years and up to 3 years 2 years More than 3 years 1 years In addition to the above at least 6 years of professional work experience gained after the award of the diploma REQUIREMENTS - SELECTION CRITERIA a. Professional experience (assessed mainly during the shortlisting): Essential: Professional experience in architecture definition, specification and in providing architecture supervision and support to ICT delivery projects Professional experience with architecture and engineering of large scale data warehouse, business intelligence and analytics solutions Professional experience with large scale data acquisition, transfer, loading and processing, including transformation of both structured and unstructured datasets, including streaming services Professional experience with self-service and/or automated data transformation and normalisation solutions Professional experience with data modelling, metadata management and data integration patterns Desirable: Experience with the architecture modelling standards and frameworks (TOGAF, Archimate, etc.) Experience with solution architecture and engineering of large scale web-based enterprise solutions, integration patterns and methods and cloud native architectures Experience with machine learning/deep learning solutions and technologies REQUIREMENTS - SELECTION CRITERIA b. Professional knowledge (assessed during the Selection procedure - Written/Practical test and/or Interview): Essential: Knowledge of large scale data acquisition, ingestion, transfer, (self service and automated) transformation, normalisation, dashboarding, data visualization methods and toolsets, including streaming data sources Knowledge of data lake, data warehousing, data virtualisation technologies, methods and tools Knowledge of architecture modelling and design techniques, including master/metadata management and data quality methods and approaches Knowledge of Data Science concepts, methods and toolsets Knowledge in the domain of Information Security Desirable: Knowledge of the architecture modelling standards and frameworks (TOGAF, Archimate, etc.) - certificate or hands-on experience Knowledge of solution architecture and engineering of large scale web-based enterprise solutions, integration patterns and methods, microservices architectures and cloud native architectures - certificate or hands-on experience Knowledge of machine learning/deep learning solutions and technologies - certificate or hands-on experience c. General competencies (assessed during the Selection procedure - Written/Practical test and/or Interview): Communicating: Excellent communication skills in English, both orally and in writing Excellent presentation skills Ability to draft clear and concise documents on complex matters for various audiences Analysing & problem solving: Excellent analytical and problem solving skills including the ability to anticipate potential problems, to determine and implement solutions Competent user of Microsoft Office applications (MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook) and the internet Delivering quality and results: High degree of commitment and flexibility High level of customer and service-orientation Ability to display initiative, flexibility and a drive for improvement Prioritising and organising: Ability to manage projects and familiarity with project management terminology and methodology Excellent organizational skills including the ability to plan work load, establish clear priorities and exercise initiative Resilience: Excellent ability to work well under pressure, both independently and in a team Ability to remain effective under a heavy workload and demonstrate resistance to stress Living diversity: Ability to establish and maintain effective working relations with co-workers in an international and multi-disciplinary work environment Advising: Strong ability to synthesise various data into a coherent and relevant whole, transforming it into a valuable and correct conclusion Building constructive relationships with clients, adequately identifying and managing their needs and expectations, and giving well-grounded advice d. Additional condition: Fulfil the condition stipulated in Article 5 of the Decision of the Executive Director on the Duration of contracts of employment for Temporary Agents, on the start date of the possible contract of employment, which may be offered. SELECTION PROCEDURE The Authority Authorised to Conclude Contracts of Employment (AACC) sets up a Selection Committee, which consists of at least three members, consisting of one chair and at least one member from the Administration of Europol and one member designated by the Staff Committee. In specific cases, in particular for selection procedures of experts, additional members may be designated from Europol, from outside Europol or from outside the Union institutions. The Selection Committee determines candidates’ suitability for the position by assessing their skills, experience and qualifications against the established job profile and makes an initial selection from the applications received. The Selection Committee will invite the 5 highest scoring candidates (shortlisted). All candidates having a score equal to the 5th highest scoring candidate will be included to the list of invited candidates. Shortlisted applicants are invited to participate in a post-related selection procedure, generally consisting of written and/or practical tests and competency-based interviews. The AACC takes a decision of appointment on the basis of advice from the Selection Committee, and will inform the Selection Committee accordingly. The AACC has also the possibility to establish a reserve list of successful candidates, which is, in principle, valid for 12 months. The validity of the reserve list may be extended, in principle, for 12 months. All candidates who attend the selection procedure will be informed of the outcome. Candidates who attended a selection procedure may request feedback on their performance in the written test and interview within three months after the selection procedure. Europol will not be in a position to respond to feedback inquiries received outside this time frame. The Selection Committee’s work and deliberations are confidential. It is forbidden for candidates to make direct or indirect contact with the members of the Selection Committee or for anyone to do so on their behalf. All enquiries or requests for information or documentation in relation to the competition should be addressed to the Europol Recruitment Team. Detailed information on the selection procedure, including the appeal procedure, is available in the Europol Recruitment Guidelines, which can be found on Europol’s website. SALARY Scale: AD7 The gross basic monthly salary is EUR 6.294,84 (step 1) or EUR 6.559,36 (step 2). The step in grade is determined on the basis of professional experience gained after the education required for the position and in line with applicable implementing rules. Staff pay EU tax at source but salaries are exempt from national taxes. Compulsory deductions are made for medical insurance, pension and unemployment insurance. Subject to the applicable conditions being met, as defined in the EU Staff Regulations (EUSR)/CEOS and further specified in the case law of the Court of Justice of the European Union, allowances such as expatriation allowance (16% of basic gross salary) or foreign residence allowance (4% of basic gross salary), household allowance, dependent child and / or education allowance may be granted. Staff enjoy worldwide insurance coverage by the Joint Sickness Insurance Scheme (JSIS) and are insured against sickness, the risk of occupational disease and accident. Europol offers flexible working arrangements, a comprehensive provision for annual leave as well as parental leave supporting a healthy work-life balance. Indicative net salary sample calculation AD7/1: a) Staff member (single) in receipt of expatriation allowance (16%): EUR 6.654,00 b) Staff member with two dependent children in their custody in receipt of expatriation allowance (16%): EUR 8.512,05 The above information is indicative and for information purposes only. It is merely meant to give an indication of your possible net salary in light of the currently applicable amounts of the related allowances and the level of taxation. It has no legal value and no rights can be derived from it. The information is based on figures applicable as of July 2020. TERMS AND CONDITIONS Probation period Engagement for this position is subject to the successful completion of a probationary period of 9 months. Within this period the successful candidate will have to undergo a post-related security screening. Europol reserves the right to terminate the contract of employment during or at the end of the probation period in accordance with Article 14 of CEOS. Security screening and certificate of good conduct All candidates who have successfully passed a selection procedure are required to apply for a national “certificate of good conduct” at the time an offer of employment is made. The “certificate of good conduct” must be provided to Europol prior the signature of the employment contract. In case of unfavourable entries in the “Certificate of good conduct” Europol reserves the right not to award an employment contract. However, the national certificate of good conduct does not substitute a valid full Personal Security Clearance Certificate (PSCC) that must be obtained for all Europol staff at the level indicated in this Vacancy Notice. A PSCC is a certificate issued by a competent authority establishing that an individual is security cleared. It contains: the level of clearance; the date of issuance and the date of expiry. Failure to obtain the requisite security clearance before the expiration of the probationary period may be cause for termination of employment contract. The requested level of Security Clearance for this post is: CONFIDENTIAL UE/EU CONFIDENTIAL. Contract of employment The successful candidate will be recruited in the type of post Administrator and function group AD, grade 7 pursuant to Article 2(f) CEOS and Annex I EUSR. The initial contract will be concluded for a period of 4 years (full-time – 40 hours a week). The contract may be renewed, in principle, for a period of 2 years. Any further renewal shall be for an indefinite duration. If the successful candidate is already a member of temporary staff 2(f) in the relevant function group, he/she will be offered the opportunity of contract continuity, subject to establishment plan availabilities. In exceptional cases, where justified in the interest of the service, the AACC may recruit a candidate, successful in a selection procedure for temporary staff under Article 2(f) of the CEOS, as contract staff under Article 3(a) of the CEOS, if such selection procedure is considered to be appropriate to the duties to be performed. The place of employment will be The Hague, The Netherlands. For further information on terms and conditions please consult the EU Staff Regulations which are available on Europol’s website. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION Privacy statement Europol respects your privacy and is committed to protecting your personal data. Your data will be processed in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2018/1725 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 23 October 2018 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data by the Union institutions, bodies, offices and agencies and on the free movement of such data applicable to Europol under Article 46 of the Europol Regulation. For additional information, please consult the applicable privacy statement available on our website. Statutory obligations upon leaving the service Pursuant to Article 16 of the EU Staff Regulations, EU officials and, by analogy, temporary agents continue to be bound by the duty to behave with integrity and discretion as regards the acceptance of certain appointments or benefits’ after leaving the service. Those staff members intending to engage in an occupational activity within two years of leaving the service shall inform their institution, so that it may take an appropriate decision in that respect. In cases where the intended activity is related to the work carried out by the staff member during the last three years of service and could lead to a conflict with the legitimate interests of the institution, the decision to be taken may include forbidding the staff member from undertaking it or giving its approval subject to any conditions it thinks fit. Main dates Deadline for application: 17 March 2021, 23:59 Amsterdam Time Zone Recruitment procedure: April 2021  Application process and selection procedure Please refer to the EUROPOL RECRUITMENT GUIDELINES available on Europol’s website for further details on the application process and the selection procedure. Contact details For further details on the application process please call +31 (0) 70 353 1146 or +31 (0) 70 353 1154.

title: Data Engineer
description: Data Engineer | IKEA Consumer and Market Insights | Core Business Franchise Delft (The Netherlands), Full-time You see things a little differently. So do we! We believe that what you value is more important than what your CV says. We offer positions that will challenge your skills and let you grow. Come see things a little differently with us. Who we are The world is changing and the IKEA business is changing with it. For IKEA though, one thing will always remain the same our vision to create a better everyday life for the many people. We will strengthen and develop our competences in order to meet the needs and dreams of the many people around the world. And to be accessible and relevant, wherever and whenever they wish to meet IKEA. About IKEA Consumer & Market Insights (ICMI) ICMI has the assignment to contribute to IKEA people making well founded decisions based on actionable and timely insights. ICMI delivers Consumer Insights, Strategy & Market Insights, and Brand & Range Insights. Each of these three areas develops and/or operates insight products to IKEA people across our value chain. As a Data Engineer, you will be part of the Data Engineering and Analytics chapter in ICMI. Key responsibilities As a Data engineer you work to enable the analysts, data scientists and insight specialists to efficiently gather, manage and use data. You are involved in shaping the data sets needed for successful analysis and is comfortable with using modern ways to transform and curate the data. You lead the creation of data sets and make sure they can be efficiently worked with in a modern cloud based environment. You help communicate the challenges and opportunities connected with your role both inside and outside your product team and strive to show how data is helping the team fulfill the product vision. You work with your product team every day, but especially data scientists and insight focused colleagues to provide the team with the data needed to efficiently deliver to the product roadmap. You take your colleagues by the hand and you advise in understandable language what is needed to enable you and the team to use data in the most efficient way.  You will: Combine, organize and analyze raw information from different sources across the IKEA ecosystem and external sources. Drive all aspects of collecting, integrating, modelling, processing and refinement of data as needed by your product team or area. Build, test and maintain data systems and pipelines. Evaluate business needs and objectives in collaboration with Product Team and other stakeholders. Explore ways to enhance data quality and reliability. Identify opportunities for data acquisition. Contribute to the development of analytical tools and programs, ensuring easy and standardized access and sharing of data. Work closely together with partners, peers and other relevant roles like data scientists, analysts or architects across IKEA as well as in your team. Ensure application and consistency with relevant digital frameworks, principles, guidelines and standards. Document and make the relevant know-how available. Knowledge Strong knowledge in designing efficient, robust and automated data pipelines and ETL workflows. Hands-on experience with database design in varying concepts. Expertise with data modelling and related concepts, incl. relational, non-relational and multi-dimensional modelling. Excellent knowledge in programming, preferable of several programming languages. Experience with data pipelines, data warehousing and Big Data processing. Knowledge about cloud infrastructure and computing environments. Capabilities Great numerical and analytical skills. Find solutions to tricky problems. Make decisions based on judgement, data and situation. Solve problems proactively and navigate through road blockers and obstacles. Build and maintain relationships and collaborate across Inter IKEA Group. Excellent team work and communication skills. Understand the complexity of the IKEA business and technology landscape. Able to work closely together with colleagues with complimentary skills, e.g. data scientist, business analysts etc. Required/ Relevant work experience At least Bachelor’s degree within Engineering, Computer science, Information Systems, Mathematics or related fields Preferred: Master’s degree within Engineering, Computer science, Information Systems, Mathematics or related fields Previous experience working with Data Engineering Experience as a project member in agile project environments and methodologies as well in running business activities Preferred: previous knowledge of the IKEA retail system Motivation Passion for retail and the possibilities that digital brings. Lead by example and share the IKEA culture and values. Like working in the unknown and with lots of different stakeholders. Motivated by being a key contributor to digitalise the IKEA Franchise offer and the IKEA Concept.  More Information  This is a full time position (40h/week). Travelling may be required based on business needs. Please send your application – CV and motivation letter – by 8 March 2021. Please note that we are continuously interviewing candidates.

title: First Party Assets Capability Analyst
description: Job Advert You’ll join our Marketing Excellence team where innovations make a clear commercial impact. And no matter how quickly our markets moves, you move quicker. With responsibility from day one you’ll grow innovative solutions that Create a Cleaner World.  Focusing on insights which define our brands direction, You’ll: Produce comprehensive and insightful reports based on 1st party assets (websites, apps, connected packages, digital couponing) Analyse customer results to drive improvements in our digital activities Support strategic research using primary, secondary, and syndicated data sources Build regular performance summaries and fill ad-hoc requests for Hygiene team Map data from multiple internal and externals sources to present customer insights and overall value of a specific campaign Translate complex data sets into clear and compelling visualized narrative Provide audience profiles and sizing estimates for assessments and planning Provide clear and meaningful fact-based recommendations to strategy, content, and operational teams  You’ll succeed because… …you’re a natural member of the team because you. You: Have experience in operating models that reach beyond the traditional Have 5+ years’ experience in data analysis Have experience in predictive analytics (preferred) Have worked in an FMCG setting before Experienced working in an agile environment Are an innovative thinker who isn’t happy maintaining the status quo Have the ability to understand consumer journeys and combine data from different tools Have the leadership, communication and writing skills to convey key insights from your analysis Have excellent presentation skills and expertise delivering research insights  You will bring skills to the table. You will be: Delivering insights and improvements on potential categories, innovations and continuous improvement Identifying disrupted online consumer journeys Supporting the teams with ad hoc requests on performance reports Supporting the teams with audience segmentation  You’ll love it because… You’ll love it because you’ll get to make an impact like never before. The products you get out there will make people’s lives better. Our Hygiene Home brands will provide an incredible platform for you. And our dynamic, ownership-driven culture will help bring the very best out of you, every day. Equality In Return RB offer very competitive salaries with excellent benefits and the chance to progress your career within a truly global organisation. RB is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by appropriate law. All hiring decisions are made based on merit, competence and business need.

title: Operations Analyst
description: At TripActions the Travel Experience (TE) Operations team works at the intersection of the most important issues facing the Travel Experience team. It is a small, well-rounded group, that works closely with senior leadership and cross functionally shaping and driving strategic, operational, and organizational improvements across the Travel Experience team, such as: Global Travel Experience strategy and implementation of change Being the critical interface with R&D (product, engineering) to ensure tech approach to self serve and post booking travel support experience. New business customer implementation and transition management Together with partner operations, driving the true TMC delivery Driving customer insights to deliver improvements in quality, learning, and product roadmap Ownership of channel infrastructure and agent desktop software to establish a world class agent and customer experience Own change management efforts for org readiness and adoption of Travel Experience agent desktop tools to establish a world class agent and customer experience In the role of Operational Analyst, you'll work directly with your peer group in Travel Experience Operations and are heavily involved in the quality and trend analysis of internal customer support quality and external customer experience. The priority and opportunity is to research trends, through understanding our data, scoping opportunities and execute with clear plans for improvements. All of this includes: Ownership of the overall quality assurance (QA) program: Own, maintain and optimise the QA model. Run regular trend analysis to ensure deep level insight into quality improvement opportunities. Maintain global alignment with managers through engaging calibrations. Own the vendor relationship to use technology in order to develop better automated technological solutions. Lead our customer insights initiatives for Travel Experience. Conduct weekly / monthly insights on our internal and external customer performance. Develop and improve leadership reporting with deep level data analysis. Own the customer satisfaction program, seek understanding of opportunities and collaborate with learning and development and channel infrastructure to influence our learning program and product prioritization for improvements. Run campaigns across Travel Experience on how we structurally improve our operations based on the trend analyses. Reporting to the Senior Director of Global Travel Experience Operations, the Operations Analyst thrives in a high growth environment and easily adjusts to rapid changes in people, process, and product. You are very analytical, structured, and detail-oriented with a sharp focus on prioritization and high execution power. What You'll Do: Core responsibilities for the job include: Identifying and owning all customer insights responsibilities. The ownership shows in delivering proactive solutions to the trends you identify. Acting as a trusted advisor for the Travel Experience Operations team and fulfilling the responsibilities to enable planning and execution of higher quality service and efficiency programs. Quality assurance program owner: Manage and coordinate the enablement for new agents and managers through collaboration with the learning and development team. Effectively set up and maintain the QA system Calabrio to utilize all its functionalities with the result of great agent and manager experience. Create global consistency amongst managers hosting calibration sessions and develop learning plans to align and increase the QA reviews. Collaborate with the data team to create and maintain QA data reports. Analyse data and drive improvements with agents and managers. Perform QAs on dissatisfied customers (CSAT), collaborate with the director of channel infrastructure and customer care team to ensure we take action to improve experience. Customer insights Build and maintain a deep level reporting overview that is fit for purpose to be read by all levels in the Travel Experience organisation. Analyze and use data driven analyses to advise support operations, learning and development, and channel infrastructure on what actions are needed to increase customer satisfaction and efficiency of service. Engage with agents and managers to run regular focus groups and surveys to understand the agent experience, internal tooling and establish opportunities for improvements. Support the director of channel infrastructure with product feedback ticket prioritization. Identify the problem, evaluate the size and importance and apply agile prioritization. Travel Experience campaigns Identify trends through data, focus groups and surveys to implement a collaborative campaign with the aim to increase quality and efficiency. What We're Looking For: Data driven personality, ability to scope and research, build and present plans and execute according to well defined timelines. Execute upon the vision, mission, and strategies for the department in alignment with TripActions and Travel Experience annual goals. Strong organizational skills to manage multiple concurrent projects Strong ability to scope and identify opportunities Ability to clearly present and communicate to key stakeholders Excellent in focus on what matters and use emotional control Ability to easily create and build relationships across varied teams, in varied locations and time zones, both internally and externally, whilst challenging the status quo Creative, solutions-driven person who acts independently whilst keeping your team(s) aligned Prioritization legend, understand when and how to say no, or later

title: Technician Process Development
description: We are Kiadis, when it comes to life-threatening diseases, we are one family. Kiadis is leveraging the natural strengths of human immune systems to source the best cells to produce innovative therapies for life-threatening disease. We are focused on NK cell research & development to maximize the potential of NK cell therapeutics. Kiadis is a leader in creating cutting-edge science in the exciting and emerging fields of cell therapy and immuno-oncology.  In support of developing our innovative NK cell therapies, we are looking for Technician Process Development based in Amsterdam, the Netherlands.  The role As a Technician Process Development, you start your day in our newly renovated state of the art lab, with an amazing view. You set-up all equipment and prepare reagents. Then it is time for a nice cup of coffee. The rest of the day you will be processing cells, think isolation of cells from blood, maintenance of cells, cell sampling and analytics, and of course logging everything – the standard lab activities. In the afternoon you work on documentation together with the team. In your day-to-day you will also: Prepare, execute, manage and document process development activities. Manage all practical and experimental aspects of cell therapy process development studies and provide training to support technical transfer activities. Manage, process and prepare experimental data for reporting/trending. Provide hands-on technical support and expertise to other operations departments. Support in the automatization and upscaling of the activities.  The department The Kiadis Operations team is responsible for all aspects of CMC development, manufacturing, procurement, planning and customer service. We are a group of experienced professionals – cell therapy experts, biologists, engineers, analysts, production associates, and more, driven by the passion to develop and supply innovative cell therapy products, directly to patients. We work through a global network of internal and external laboratories and production facilities, and interact on a daily basis with apheresis centers and hospitals around the world. Join us and see for yourself how your talent and skills will bring us closer to our ultimate goal: helping patients worldwide.  The ideal candidate We are looking for someone that shares our love for cells, and likes being part of a dynamic organization. It would be great if you have the following requirements: Bachelor/Master in Cell Biology, Biotechnology, Bioprocess Engineering, or related fields. At least 2-4 years of experience in industrial cell therapy or other biopharmaceutical process development. Excellent knowledge of (primary/mammalian) cell culture. Hands-on experience with automatic cell processing, bioreactors (stirred tank and/or wave bag) and/or DSP techniques Excellent team player, capable of working independently and with good communication skills. Analytical mindset, conscientious and curious. No nine-to-five mentality. Fluency in English, other languages are a plus.  What we offer People from all over the world, together as one team, contribute to improving the lives of patients every day. We offer an exciting position in an innovative, dynamic and inspiring environment where you'll receive a competitive remuneration package, autonomy and the opportunity to make your own mark within the organization. We create an environment where ideas are shared, experiences are impactful, and talent is developed. Because of our inclusive and family-like environment, you will always have the feeling of belonging & appreciation.  Note to External Recruiters: All candidate activity and open positions are managed strictly through our Talent Acquisition Department. We kindly request that recruiters not contact employees/hiring managers directly in an attempt to solicit business and present candidates. Submission of unsolicited resumes prior to an agreement set in place between the Talent Acquisition Department and the recruiting agency will not create any implied obligation.

title: Manager Data Analytics Internal Audit COE
description: This role has primary responsibility for developing and delivering the Data Analytics (DA) Internal Audit (IA) strategy. The role holder is required to be a DA specialist with a proven record of embedding DA within teams and leading DA projects and DA Center of Excellence (COE) members. The role involves operationalizing the IA data analytics strategy by building out roadmaps, identifying KPIs and delivering required training / coaching and technology usage by the IA teams i.e. analytics should become part of the way of working of the whole IA function. The role holder will own the IA data analytics methodology and actively contribute to advancing digital analytics more widely for the function. The role also involves application of advanced analysis techniques to IA processes enhancing assurance coverage, providing well founded insights, creating visual impact, and digitalization of key audit tasks. The role is accountable for leading the IA Data Analytics Center of Excellence (COE) and providing analytics support to all IA teams across all of Aegon (TA, UK ANL, AAM, GTS, Spain, and Asia) and executing intermediate and advanced analytics as required. The role holder is required to: liaise with first line Business Data Analytic Teams, second line Risk teams as well as the Strategic Business Unit (SBU) IA Data Analytics champions; develop and maintain strong external links with suppliers and peers to bring the latest in analytics thinking to IA; support and direct SUB Snr Data Analyst/Data Analysts when undertaking COE tasks; help IA teams locate the data needed to execute their analytics, understand the audit objectives that the analytic needs to solve; facilitate the auditors to embed quality analytics in line with methodology. Lead the IA data analytics Center of Excellence (COE) and continue to evolve best practice approaches and use of analytics in IA. To spot synergies and potential re-use analytic options. Lead, motivate and coach DA champions within audit teams to ensure DA are included within audit services and are delivered. Coach and train auditors both in analytics best practices and technology usage, working the curriculum in conjunction with IA GLT. Support and direct members of the COE, including the TA Senior Data Analyst when undertaking COE tasks. Actively develops our people’s DA skills, by understanding their skills and ambition and identifying opportunities for them to develop enhanced DA skills. The role will also involve reporting on KPI’s and progress being made as well as continuous research of best practices so that data analytics continues to evolve within the IA teams and the function as a whole. Requirements As a Manager Data Analytics you will have strong customer focus and stakeholder management skills. The candidate must bring a high degree of intellectual and emotional maturity, as well as curiosity and a demonstrated ability to think strategically. Moreover, you have the following attributes: Master’s degree for example in Finance, Econometrics or Economics; Extensive Data Analytics experience; Proven track record of a minimum of 5 - 8 years within DA in similar role or context; Extensive experience in working with SAS, PowerBi and/or Tableau; Proven experience working as a leader in a management capacity; Experience of working in an international environment; Proven experience in advising and supporting senior management (i.e. IA GLT); Working knowledge of data analytics in internal audit context; Understanding of technical developments relevant to the role; Excellent communication and team working skills with an ability to collaborate and work virtually across regions and all levels of the organization; Analytical with a questioning nature and proficient at making connections between information and data; High standard of accuracy and excellent written English; Experience in data analysis, dashboards and reporting; Audit, Risk and / or Operational business knowledge is an advantage. Terms and conditions of employment We offer you an interesting position where you work independently and professionally in an ambitious and dynamic organisation. Growth and development are important to us, that is why we invest amply in our employees in the form of development and career possibilities. In exchange for your commitment and efforts we offer you an extensive and excellent package of pay and benefits, e.g.: a competitive monthly salary; in addition you receive a fixed 13th month’s salary and holiday allowance in the form of a monthly flexible budget of 16.7% of your monthly salary; good balance between work and private life with at least 27 holiday days; an appropriate commuting allowance; excellent pension scheme and discount on Aegon products. Interested? Does this role appeal to you? We then look forward to receiving your cv and motivation via our application form on this website. An online assessment is part of the selection process. For more information about the application procedure you can contact Dave Heilbron, Sr. Talent Acquisition Manager Dave.Heilbron@aegon.com or +31 (0)6 83 25 44 97

title: Sr BI Developer
description: Providing our customers better and more service and services by leveraging data. This is how you help our customers Your day job is to put data to work for the customer and the business 24-7. As Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Developer, you collaborate with end users and Data & Insights colleagues to design and develop solutions that generate actionable insights. Together with your squad members, you work on complex and challenging projects to make data sources accessible, integrate mobile and fixed data, and present data that’s fit for purpose. All of which should come naturally to you, thanks to your excellent communication skills combined with a pragmatic approach and keen sense of humor. And of course, we don’t have to explain data models to you; you can practically read them in your sleep. Which is the level of expertise that’s required to integrate our sustainable solutions seamlessly. You are part of a large organization, with many complex data sources that need to be integrated so that we can accurately comprehend our customers. This requires structure. This is how you do it by adding sources to our data warehouse, and integrating them in our company-wide data model coordinating with information analysts, to ensure efficient and effective BI solutions documenting your work, so that we can retrace your logic contributing to the test plan and conducting tests helping to improve existing BI solutions coaching developers who are less experienced taking the technical lead role for the deliverables of your squad You fortify VodafoneZiggo positions all BI activities in a central Data & Insights Tribe. Our specialists come from different backgrounds and cultures and work together in five business domains. As a perceptive Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Developer, you contribute to innovation, big data and data privacy initiatives within VodafoneZiggo. Analytical, results-driven and energetic are the characteristics that bind us. We inspire each other and are genuinely passionate about our profession. And there is considerable leeway to shape your job yourself. We VodafoneZiggo is a powerful combination of two leading Dutch organizations. We joined forces in January 2017 and together we further increased our success in the Netherlands. As a communications provider, we offer our customers the best in entertainment, mobile and fixed-line phone service and internet. Our products and services inspire people, businesses and society to connect. Whether on the road, at home or at work.  We are over 8,000 employees strong, brimming with energy and socially engaged. Proud of what we accomplish and of the people that make it possible. And conscientious to provide space for everybody to develop and take advantage of opportunities. You have it The knack to understand information requirements and translate them into a technical solution. You make contacts with colleagues and internal customers effortlessly and thanks to your communication skills you convey and gather information where needed. Your grasp of operational processes and pragmatic attitude in a complex organization serve you well in this position. And because you are used to working in multidisciplinary project teams and under time pressure, you maintain your composure in every situation. This position as Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Developer at VodafoneZiggo further requires: a bachelor's, hbo- or wo degree in a relevant field, such as technical management, information science, econometrics or mathematics At least 7 years of work experience as BI/ETL developer or data warehouse specialist experience with data modeling using Data Vault or similar methods knowledge of Oracle, SQL Server and Informatica PowerC enter experienced in senior/lead positions excellent English language skills Enjoy the benefits Based on a 40-hour working week at VodafoneZiggo, you can count on: A gross salary between €3800 and €5380 per month, plenty of growth potential and an attractive bonus plan to boot 20 days of paid leave A monthly Benefit Budget of 14.95% of your gross salary. To use as you see fit! Put money aside for an adventurous (or super leisurely) holiday? Save up for a sabbatical? Take a few extra days off? Or simply spend the extra cash on whatever you fancy? It is up to you! Unlimited Learning! The VodafoneZiggo menu has thousands of educational choices – an all you can learn experience! A voucher for a smartphone, and a Vodafone subscription to go with it. And yes, you can use it for personal calls as well. Discounts on Vodafone and Ziggo products and services A worry-free pension plan that also allows you to save extra An NS-Business Card tailored to your personal travel habits. Including a 1st class option, that you can even use for personal trips / Flexibility: work where and when you perform your best We value social impact. You can participate in social initiatives during work hours and increase your positive contribution. An example? By joining our Online Masters program, you can teach children how to navigate the digital world safely and responsibly. Setbacks in your personal life? We offer excellent (financial) arrangements to minimize the impact of adversity. For example when you are unable to work. You’ll do it Are you in? Are you the Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Developer we’re looking for to provide our customers better and more services by leveraging data? Click on the apply button to get in touch. Questions? Sanne van der Meer will be happy to answer them. Send an email to: sanne.vandermeer@vodafoneziggo.com  A pre-employment screening is part of the hiring process. This job posting is open to all who wish to join the VodafoneZiggo team. No sales calls please.

title: Junior business development analist voor marktleider in retail
description: Please mind that fluency in Dutch is required for this position. Na je eerste stap in consultancy werken in één van de meest succesvolle en dynamische omgevingen van het moment? Onze klant — decennialang marktleider in de Benelux — zoekt een senior business development analist. Jij vertaalt strategie naar praktijk en maakt deze partij, samen met je gedreven team dat direct rapporteert aan de CEO, de grootste en beste omnichannel retailer van de Benelux. Over de opdrachtgever Onze opdrachtgever is sinds vele jaren marktleider in de Benelux binnen hun retailsegment, namelijk alles voor huis en tuin, maar ook interieur en styling. Duurzaamheidsproposities, samenwerkingen met interior bloggers, sponsoring van topsporters en goede doelen; deze partij gaat verder dan producten en diensten alleen. Met een relatief klein hoofdkantoor zijn zij wendbaar en innovatief. Het uitstekende winkelnetwerk, de omnichannel propositie, analytics en gezonde commerciële slagkracht vormen een solide basis voor de ambitie om hét adres te worden om van je huis en tuin een echt thuis te maken. De huidige situatie rondom COVID-19 heeft gezorgd voor een vergrote belangstelling voor deze kant van retail. De flexibiliteit bij onze opdrachtgever maakt dat ze hier snel op in hebben kunnen spelen. De interessante groei die ze momenteel doormaken, maakt dit bedrijf dan ook een solide werkgever. Ben je als consultant dus op zoek naar een coronaproof consulting exit, dan is dit een interessant momentum. Over de functie Als junior business development analist bevind jij je in het kloppend hart van de organisatie. Je bent onderdeel van het team Strategie & Transformatie, dat rapporteert aan de CEO. Je schakelt met verschillende afdelingen om jouw initiatieven voor bijvoorbeeld commercie, operations, finance, supply chain en IT te kickstarten. Die initiatieven variëren van strategisch tot meer tactisch van aard. Denk aan ijzersterke pricingstrategieën en nieuwe proposities tot logistieke optimalisaties en het gebruiken van data als basis voor commerciële en operationele besluitvorming. Na het identificeren, analyseren en vormgeven van je initiatieven (waarbij je nauw samenwerkt met het senior management) neem je de rol van projectverantwoordelijke op je. Jij schakelt met de business en begeleidt de afdelingen in de uitrol van jouw ideeën. Een unieke kans om alle disciplines van de organisatie te leren kennen en resultaat te zien. De perfecte rol voor een strateeg die ook energie krijgt van projectmanagement, het meemaken van resultaat en impact wil maken in de top van dit bedrijf. Bovendien biedt deze rol uitstekende doorgroeimogelijkheden naar een managementpositie binnen het bedrijf, doordat je de organisatie van binnen en buiten leert kennen. Locatie: midden van het land. Voorbeelden van projecten Het doorvoeren van een duurzame propositie: hoe kunnen wij onze klanten het beste helpen bij het verduurzamen van hun huis? Van advies tot uiteindelijk materiaal, een nieuwe propositie van A tot Z Het neerzetten van een best-in-class webshop: inspiratie, assortiment, logistiek, customer journey – alle aspecten van een webshop komen hier bij elkaar Het verbeteren van kwaliteit op de winkelvloer: hoe zorgen we dat medewerkers jou nog beter kunnen helpen met al jouw klantvragen Ruimte maken om te investeren: hoe kunnen we de inefficiënties uit ons proces halen, om zo kosten te besparen? En hoe kunnen we deze besparingen zo goed mogelijk investeren? Belangrijkste criteria Je hebt circa 2 jaar ervaring als strategie- en/of businessconsultant of vergelijkbare ervaring bij FMCG of retailer. Je hebt een master. Retailervaring is een pré. Je focust je niet alleen op jouw taak, maar neemt eigenaarschap voor het totaal. Je bent zowel strategisch en analytisch als implementatiegericht. Je weet goed je weg te vinden in een grote organisatie, bent zelfstartend en energiek. Reden van de vacature Wegens groei door succes is extra mankracht zeer welkom. De procedure Na een gesprek bij Badenoch + Clark volgen er drie bij deze opdrachtgever. Een business case maakt onderdeel uit van de procedure. Contact Ben je een business development analist of op weg er een te worden en herken je jezelf in de visie van deze opdrachtgever? Mail je cv en korte motivatie naar Kiki Jansen (kiki.jansen@badenochandclark.nl) of solliciteer via deze website.

title: Business Analist Customer Contact Experience
description: De verschillende business units hebben wensen, jij hebt antwoorden. Dankzij jouw data-analyses maak je inzichtelijk hoe zij het beste hun prioriteiten kunnen stellen. De behoeftes van de klant staan centraal. Samen komen we tot de meest efficiënte inrichting van onze klantenservice en behalen we optimale klanttevredenheid.  Deze baan, waarbij je veel vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid krijgt om aan interessante vraagstukken te werken, biedt je een salaris van maximaal € 6.009,56 bruto per maand op basis van 36 uur. Jouw impact als Business Analist bij NN Jij zet je talenten dagelijks in om interne en externe IT-data te verzamelen, analyseren en beoordelen. Hiervoor doe je analyses op ons customer data platform en vraag je bij verschillende afdelingen, business units en het management aanvullende informatie op. Hierbij hoort ook het stellen van kritische vragen. Zodra je conclusies trekt, ga je aan de slag met het maken van gestructureerde voorstellen voor verbeteringen. De impact van deze optimalisaties op de organisatie hou je in je achterhoofd. De voorstellen presenteer je vervolgens aan het management. Je werkt daarbij nauw samen met de Lead Strategy aan diverse strategie projecten. Wat je gaat doen Goed onderbouwde besluitvorming en duidelijke richtingen voor verbeterinitiatieven en de bedrijfsstrategie Je gestructureerde voorstellen voor verbetering zijn van hoge kwaliteit Met al onze verbeteringen bieden we een optimale, eenduidige en relevante ervaring aan onze klanten Met wie je werkt Als Business Analist zit je binnen het domein Customer Contact Experience. Ons doel is de meest effectieve en efficiënte klantenservice in te richten voor NN. Iedere dag hebben wij contact met een groot aantal van onze 5 miljoen klanten in Nederland, via nn.nl, chat(bot), email en telefonisch. Het domein Customer Contact Experience speelt een verbindende rol tussen de verschillende business units van Nationale-Nederlanden. Wij leveren expertise en IT ondersteuning aan de contact centers van de business units om klanten zo goed mogelijk te bedienen, op een efficiënte manier. Daarmee verhogen we de klanttevredenheid en verlagen we de kosten. We maken onze dienstverlening persoonlijk en relevant op een makkelijke digitale werkwijze. Wat je meebrengt Door je liefde voor data ga je dagelijks met plezier aan het werk. Je hebt ruime kennis en ervaring met relevante tools zoals Power BI. Met het verzamelen van de benodigde data heb je geen moeite, want met je vlotte babbel en je aanstekelijk enthousiasme bouw je al snel een sterk netwerk op binnen NN. Zodra je de kans ziet om het gewenste resultaat te behalen, pak je die met beide handen aan. En de link tussen IT en de impact daarvan op onze processen heb je razendsnel door. Heb je ervaring met Lean of soortgelijke methodes? Dat is mooi meegenomen. Je bent in het bezit van een Master diploma en hebt bij voorkeur ervaring bij een financiële dienstverlener. Ervaring in een customer contact omgeving 4-5 jaar ervaring als Data Intelligence Expert Een flink analytisch vermogen en het talent om IT te vertalen naar de business en andersom Blijf je ontwikkelen Wij vinden het belangrijk dat jij je kunt blijven ontwikkelen. We geven je de ruimte en het vertrouwen om te groeien in je carrière en als mens. Wij helpen je hierbij met: Volop training- en opleidingsmogelijkheden in ons Learning & Development Centre Een groot (internationaal) netwerk van collega’s die graag hun kennis met je delen De autonomie om je eigen ontwikkelroute te bepalen Over NN Wij helpen mensen zorgen voor wat zij echt belangrijk vinden. De wereld waarin we leven mag dan veranderen, wat er echt toe doet voor mensen, blijft hetzelfde. Familie, vrienden, liefde, gezondheid, thuis en werk natuurlijk ook. Met jouw inzet maken we onze dienstverlening persoonlijker en relevanter. Zo kunnen we als organisatie echt het verschil maken vanuit al onze merken: Nationale-Nederlanden, NN Investment Partners, ABN AMRO Verzekeringen, Movir, AZL, BeFrank, Zicht en OHRA. Arbeidsvoorwaarden die bij jou passen Jij bent meer dan alleen een collega en dat snappen we bij NN heel goed. Je hebt verschillende rollen in het leven en daar horen keuzes bij. Wij stellen jou in staat arbeidsvoorwaarden te kiezen die voor jou belangrijk zijn en aansluiten bij jouw privésituatie. Denk aan het bijkopen van vakantiedagen en flexibele werktijden. Je vakantiegeld en 13de maand ontvang je maandelijks bij je salaris, daar hoef je niet op te wachten. Vanwege het coronavirus werken alle NN collega’s op dit moment volledig digitaal en vanuit huis. Het is op dit moment ook nog niet duidelijk wanneer we weer op kantoor kunnen werken. De officiële standplaats voor deze functie is Den Haag. Solliciteer direct! Heb je nog vragen over de vacature of de procedure? Bel of stel je vraag via WhatsApp aan Marije Ledeboer, Senior Recruiter via 06-22908463 of via marije.ledeboer@nn-group.com. Het gaat hier om een permanente positie. Een kandidaat ontvangt een contract van NN en we staan niet open voor interim/freelance opdrachten en/of kandidaten of acquisitie door bureaus. Alvast bedankt voor uw begrip.

title: Data Engineer Informatica/Oracle
description: We zoeken versterking voor het nieuwe team Dataplatform binnen Strategie, Data, IT en Pricing. Als jij het in je hebt om de data ambities van Schade&Inkomen samen met je collega’s een boost te geven en de onderstaande resultaten neer te zetten dan is dit een functie die op je lijf is geschreven. Jouw impact als Data Engineer bij NN Schade & Inkomen De data die door het S&I landschap stroomt vertegenwoordigt veel waarde. Deze data moet juist en tijdig beschikbaar zijn voor onze interne processen, maar ook op de momenten dat ze nodig zijn in onze contacten met de klant. Het extraheren, transformeren en laden van data is een van je belangrijkste activiteiten. Je focus ligt op het efficiënt en betrouwbaar verwerken van alle data waarbij rekening gehouden wordt met zaken als data kwaliteit, performance en architectuur eisen Wat je gaat doen Je bouwt en onderhoudt ETL programmatuur die in en externe S&I administraties ontsluit naar het centrale dataplatform Je bent bedreven in analyse, ontwerp, bouw, test, en houdt rekening met eisen vanuit performance en beheer Je zoekt actief de samenwerking met zowel gebruikers van het platform als ook de leverende partijen Je vindt het uitdagend om het data platform continue te verbeteren en gaat hierover in gesprek met je collega engineers, de Product Owners, de DQ Officers en de Data architect Je gaat met klanten in gesprek over hun wensen en komt gezamenlijk tot de beste oplossing, waarbij een goede afweging plaatsvindt tussen de eisen vanuit zowel IT als de Business Je automatiseert alle saaie en repeterende zaken zodat er meer tijd is voor de zaken die er echt toe doen Met wie je werkt Het team Data Platform is verantwoordelijk voor het centrale S&I data platform en bestaat uit een vaste kern van ongeveer 20 medewerkers die wordt aangevuld met medewerkers die op projectbasis worden ingezet. Je collega’s hebben de volgende rollen: Data Architect, DQ officer, Data Analist, Data Engineer, Data Modeller, Product Owner, Service Manager. We werken op een Agile manier Wat je meebrengt Je hebt minimaal HBO werk- of denkniveau Je bezit probleemoplossend vermogen en bent communicatief sterk Je hebt passie voor IT en Data en ervaring met Agile werken Je hebt meerjarige ervaring met Informatica PC/DQ en Oracle databases Blijf je ontwikkelen Wij vinden het belangrijk dat jij je kunt blijven ontwikkelen. We geven je de ruimte en het vertrouwen om te groeien in je carrière en als mens. Wij helpen je hierbij met: Volop training- en opleidingsmogelijkheden in ons Learning & Development Centre Een groot (internationaal) netwerk van collega’s die graag hun kennis met je delen De autonomie om je eigen ontwikkelroute te bepalen Over NN Wij helpen mensen zorgen voor wat zij echt belangrijk vinden. De wereld waarin we leven mag dan veranderen, wat er echt toe doet voor mensen, blijft hetzelfde. Familie, vrienden, liefde, gezondheid, thuis en werk natuurlijk ook. Met jouw inzet maken we onze dienstverlening persoonlijker en relevanter. Zo kunnen we als organisatie echt het verschil maken vanuit al onze merken: Nationale-Nederlanden, NN Investment Partners, ABN AMRO Verzekeringen, Movir, AZL, BeFrank, Zicht en OHRA. Arbeidsvoorwaarden die bij jou passen Jij bent meer dan alleen een collega en dat snappen we bij NN heel goed. Je hebt verschillende rollen in het leven en daar horen keuzes bij. Wij stellen jou in staat arbeidsvoorwaarden te kiezen die voor jou belangrijk zijn en aansluiten bij jouw privésituatie. Denk aan het bijkopen van vakantiedagen. Je vakantiegeld en 13de maand ontvang je maandelijks bij je salaris, daar hoef je niet op te wachten. Vanwege het coronavirus werken alle NN collega’s op dit moment volledig digitaal en vanuit huis. Het is op dit moment ook nog niet duidelijk wanneer we weer op kantoor kunnen werken. De officiële standplaats voor deze functie is Den Haag. Als Data Engineer werk je vanuit ons mooie kantoor in Den Haag. Direct naast de A12, maar ook goed bereikbaar met het openbaar vervoer. Liever even uitwaaien? Pak de tram of (ov-)fiets en in een klein half uurtje ben je op het strand. Word jij onze nieuwe collega? Ben jij enthousiast over deze vacature en denk je dat je goed past in het team en bij NN? Dan nodigen wij je uit om te solliciteren. Wij zijn erg benieuwd naar wie jij bent, wat jou beweegt en wat jij kunt bijdragen in deze functie bij NN. Solliciteer direct! Heb je nog vragen over de vacature of de procedure? Bel of stel je vraag via WhatsApp aan Jordi Spijker (Recruiter) via 06-215 875 92. Het gaat hier om een permanente positie. Een kandidaat ontvangt een contract van NN en we staan niet open voor interim/freelance opdrachten en/of kandidaten of acquisitie door bureaus. Alvast bedankt voor uw begrip.

title: Web Analist
description: Amsterdam –Automotive Mediaventions is een joint venture tussen DPG Media en Mediahuis. Ter uitbreiding van het team zijn we op zoek naar een web analist!  Wat ga je doen Als web analist bij Automotive Mediaventions ben je continu bezig met het analyseren van het verkeer op de websites van de drie merken Gaspedaal, AutoTrack en Autowereld. Hiervoor heb je diverse tools tot je beschikking zoals Google Analytics, Snowplow, Supermetrics, Usabilla etc. Door data te koppelen, analyseren en vertalen ben jij goed in staat de business te adviseren en direct sturing op lopende processen en campagnes te geven. Het is dan ook van belang dat je een echte teamplayer bent en op zowel operationeel als strategisch niveau kunt meedraaien. Verder ben je verantwoordelijk voor: De tag management omgeving (GTM) van de drie verschillende websites. Het consistent configureren en onderhouden van Google Analytics 360. Je houd je bezig met data analyse kijkende naar het pricingbeleid. Het opstellen van meetplannen voor nieuwe functionaliteiten. Het inrichten en onderhouden van dashboards en rapportages. Het adviseren van de business bij het interpreteren van de cijfers in dashboards zoals: Het adviseren over de inzet van uiteenlopende marketing platformen bij online en omnichannel campagnes. Voorstellen voor verbetering van conversie (van marketingkanalen en de website). Het begeleiden van A/B en multivariable testen; van het opstellen van de test hypothese tot de het in productie nemen van testresultaat.  Wie zijn wij Je komt in een zeer hecht team terecht waar veel gelachen wordt en minstens zo hard gewerkt. Niet lullen maar poetsen is het credo en iedereen ervaart veel vrijheid om zijn/haar eigen dagen in te delen. Met deze vrijheid komt een grote mate van zelfstandigheid en die moet je aankunnen. Het marketing team bestaat uit 9 zeer gedreven collega’s die allen hun eigen specialisme hebben en die gezamenlijk optrekken om er met elkaar een succes van te maken.   Over Automotive Mediaventions Met sterke merken als Gaspedaal, AutoTrack en Autowereld zijn wij dé partner voor bedrijven binnen de Nederlandse automotive markt en bereiken we maandelijks 6 miljoen bezoekers. De sites zijn complementair aan elkaar en bedienen grotendeels verschillende typen consumenten en zakelijke klanten. Waar Gaspedaal het beschikbare auto-aanbod in Nederland vertoont, biedt AutoTrack extra checks, informatie en zekerheden rondom de aangeboden auto’s en is Autowereld het freemium alternatief voor de zakelijke adverteerder. Daarnaast biedt Automotive Mediaventions B.V. als joint venture van DPG Media en Mediahuis een gecombineerde bereik van beide mediahuizen. Met o.a. AD, Telegraaf, Volkskrant, Nu.nl en Q-music zijn de twee merken zichtbaar naar de Nederlandse autokoper, en profiteren de adverteerders van zowel een landelijk als regionaal bereik voor hun advertenties. Wij bieden jou Salaris, passend bij jouw ervaring. Je ontvangt 8% vakantiegeld en 4% persoonlijk budget. 36-urige werkweek. Volop opleidings- en ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden. Een leuk en dynamisch team waar je veel mee gaat samenwerken.  Functie eisen Je hebt minimaal vier jaar werkervaring als web analist. Je bent analytisch, nauwkeurig en nieuwsgierig van aard. Je hebt alle levels van Google Analytics uitgespeeld en kunt goed analyses maken in diverse analytics en marketing tools. Je kunt businessvragen en -doelstellingen vertalen naar een dashboard omgeving. Je hebt ervaring met A/B en multivariate testing en kan overweg met tools als Google Optimize. Het is een pré als je ervaring hebt met Javascript, SQL of andere talen. Je vindt het leuk om je (verder) te ontwikkelen in complexere data vraagstukken.  Word jij onze nieuwe collega? Solliciteer dan nu! Heb jij eerst nog vragen? Ik beantwoord die graag via roxanne.rinkes@dpgmedia.nl of 06-21370122. Een WhatsApp bericht mag ook.  Wij doen graag onze werving zelf en wensen niet samen te werken met externe partijen voor de invulling van deze rol.

title: Azure Data Engineer
description: Freelancing Allowed Dutch language Mandatory Job description: As an Azure Data Engineer, you have a passion for working with data. Your ultimate goal is to make clean and usable data available to our regulators and other users to support the monitoring process. You have an eye for technology, but you are also a discussion partner for those who depend on data. You are someone who sees data as a business asset and from this vision you are driven to do both further develop and professionalize cloud technology as capabilities. Because data is rarely available ready to use and is offered in different shapes and sizes, you feel more than at home in data assessment and data preparation. You know the different possibilities of data storage and the ways to access them. You are familiar with working with the Cloud environment (MS Azure) and data processing patterns in this environment. You are a team player who enjoys working with others to ensure that the AFM fulfills its ambition to become a data-driven regulator. After all, it is all about providing the regulator with optimal support task with the use of data. As an Azure Data Engineer, you are responsible for: PLEASE NOTE: we are looking for a highly experienced Azure Data Engineer who has extensive experience with Azure and is familiar with working in this environment. Implement structural data processing for supervisory processes in multidisciplinary teams. Design and set up generic capabilities for the Managed Data Platform. Assess data quality from external sources and implement cleaning steps. Supporting the users of the data. Advising in and implementing solutions for complex data models and data analyzes using cloud technology (Azure). High quality of data processing software and minimization of technical debt. A (pro) active contribution to the multidisciplinary DevOps team and further development of DevOps practices. Other duties and responsibilities Translating (complex) problems into workable generic solutions Propose ideas for the translation of questions into MS Azure cloud solutions and in this way create solutions that meet the stated wishes and requirements Determining a development approach based in part on best practices and industry standards Ensuring high quality and documentation of projects Provide solicited and unsolicited advice to internal customers and stakeholders.
