You: Have experience in operating models that reach beyond the traditional Have 5+ years’ experience in data analysis Have experience in predictive analytics (preferred) Have worked in an FMCG setting before Experienced working in an agile environment Are an innovative thinker who isn’t happy maintaining the status quo Have the ability to understand consumer journeys and combine data from different tools Have the leadership, communication and writing skills to convey key insights from your analysis Have excellent presentation skills and expertise delivering research insights  You will bring skills to the table. You will be: Delivering insights and improvements on potential categories, innovations and continuous improvement Identifying disrupted online consumer journeys Supporting the teams with ad hoc requests on performance reports Supporting the teams with audience segmentation  You’ll love it because… You’ll love it because you’ll get to make an impact like never before. The products you get out there will make people’s lives better. Our Hygiene Home brands will provide an incredible platform for you. And our dynamic, ownership-driven culture will help bring the very best out of you, every day. Equality In Return RB offer very competitive salaries with excellent benefits and the chance to progress your career within a truly global organisation. RB is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by appropriate law. All hiring decisions are made based on merit, competence and business need.

title: Operational Compliance Analyst
description: LIFE AT IMC AS OPERATIONAL COMPLIANCE ANALYST WHO WE ARE AND WHAT WE DO IMC is a leading global market maker, using algorithmic trading and advanced technology to buy and sell securities on multiple trading venues worldwide. We provide liquidity to the financial markets, driving efficiencies for buyers and sellers. Founded in 1989, we are an ambitious, innovative company and identified early on the importance technology would play in the fast-paced evolution of trading. This entrepreneurial spirit still drives us today and can be found in all of our offices around the world. OUR TEAM We now operate globally from offices in Europe, the US and Asia Pacific. Our employees work closely together in multidisciplinary teams, making our success possible. Technology - At IMC, technology is not a department, it is at the heart of everything we do. Our technologists push the limits of possibility, and then look beyond. In our fast-paced environment, short feedback loops mean projects worked on in the morning can enter production the next day. Trading – Although our traders come from many backgrounds they all have one thing in common: they are at their best solving complex problems. Their insight into global events, market shifts and pricing ensure we are trading in the right place, at the right time. Business Support - Around the world, IMC’s business support teams are essential for sustaining our success. In our dynamic environment, we have many exciting challenges and multidisciplinary opportunities to shape our operations and make a real impact. OUR CULTURE Our employees are our greatest asset so we give them lots of responsibility and the support they need to make a difference. Our flat structure fosters a culture of openness and collaboration, encouraging the sharing of ideas and knowledge. It makes no difference if you have been with us for three days or three years, the best idea wins. While we work hard, we also have a lot of fun; whether solving complex challenges or in team building, leisure and sporting activities. IMC also enables its employees to contribute towards a better society through our foundation. Are you someone who is passionate about challenging the status quo? Do you enjoy the process of problem solving, a process where you recognize areas of improvement and innovate to improve? Does your curiosity and desire to learn drive you? WHAT YOU’LL DO The Compliance team operates very close to our Trading and Technology teams. Main objective of the team is to ensure our organization complies at all times with external and internal regulation. We strongly believe a strong compliance culture can only be built when employees do not only adhere to the policies and rules, but also understand the context and intent of regulation. As a Compliance Analyst at IMC you will be based directly on the dealing room of our Amsterdam office. You will assist in managing the day-to-day compliance activities, like monitoring/reporting of our trading activities and onboarding counterparties. This requires knowledge of our trading strategies, counterparties, venues and of course the regulatory landscape we operate in. To excel in this role you will be combining analytical skills with operational and system knowledge to add value, and not bureaucracy to the business. We are looking for someone who is used to working with large data sets and who has knowledge of programming languages, with a critical, proactive and hands-on approach. Your tasks will include but not be limited to: Ensure regulatory transaction reports are sent timely and accurate; Ensure trading counterparties are on-boarded and reviewed timely (AML/KYC) Monitoring and analyze intraday trading activity and discuss with our Trading Desks; Advise traders on exchange rules and regulations Assist with inquiries made by exchanges or regulators Collaborate with global compliance team members to design and enhance global standards Analyze developments within the markets we trade and identify both risks and opportunities; WHAT WE LOOK FOR: University degree (preferable) 1-3 years of relevant experience with a financial services provider Broad interest in financial markets, regulatory developments and market structure Process minded and ability to improve IMC’s control framework Advanced skills in excel and experience working with large data sets Basic knowledge of derivatives, market making and coding Strong analytical / problem solving skills; Structured and concise in communication; Ability to act and perform successfully in a fast-moving and high-pressured environment. OUR HIRING PROCESS To set you up for success, you can find our hiring process including tips on applying and interviewing with us on our website . Now it’s up to you! Apply today to start an amazing journey with IMC.

title: Analyst - Intern
description: Overview: When you join Hines, you will work alongside innovative leaders who set the standards responsible for our reputation as an industry leader today, and you’ll be a part of shaping our future in the years to come. Responsibilities: As an Analyst- Intern at Hines Netherlands, you will be responsible for supporting the Investment team in the underwriting and due diligence of new acquisition and development opportunities across the real estate spectrum. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Preparing memorandums, presentations and written communication of business issues and business plans as well as proposals for Investment Committee approval Develop and maintain complex financial models for both new and existing assets; primarily in Excel and occasionally with Argus elements Compiling and maintaining a market research database Conduct local market data compilations and support the due diligence for real estate acquisitions and developments in the Netherlands Qualifications: Minimum Requirements include:  Master's degree or student about to graduate in Business, Engineering or Finance from an accredited institution Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office, including Excel and PowerPoint Strong analytical/quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem solving Able to work under tight deadlines Passion for real estate and corporate finance/private equity Excellent communication skills with fluency in written and spoken English and Dutch  Closing: Hines is a privately owned global real estate investment firm founded in 1957 with a presence in 225 cities in 25 countries. Hines has approximately $144.1 billion¹ of assets under management, including $75.5 billion for which Hines serves as investment manager, including non-real estate assets, and $68.6 billion for which Hines provides third-party property-level services. The firm has 165 developments currently underway around the world. Historically, Hines has developed, redeveloped or acquired 1,426 properties, totaling over 472 million square feet. The firm’s current property and asset management portfolio includes 576 properties, representing over 246 million square feet. With extensive experience in investments across the risk spectrum and all property types, and a pioneering commitment to sustainability, Hines is one of the largest and most-respected real estate organizations in the world. Visit www.hines.com for more information. ¹AUM includes both the global Hines organization as well as RIA AUM.  We are an equal opportunity employer and support workforce diversity.  No calls or emails from third parties at this time please.

title: Industry Spare Parts Analyst and Demand Planner
description: As the Industry Spare Parts Analyst and Demand Planner (ISPADP) main role is to analyse the industry spare parts business globally to support profitable growth of the spare parts business and manage the spare parts demand planning for the industry to secure availability and cost efficiency. The ISPADP also supports the Global Pricing Team in optimizing spare parts pricing for spare parts related to the industry. This includes monitoring and analysis of spare parts sales, profitability, demand, delivery performance and other related aspects of the spare parts business from an Industry perspective. The ISPADP works closely with the Regions, Global Supply Chain and Global Pricing Team to optimize the spare parts business and demand planning. Tasks and responsibilities as an Industry Spare Parts Analyst and Demand Planner (ISPADP); Monitor and analyse spare parts global sales and business for the Industry (development of sales per region, profitability, lead times delivery performance etc.) Working closely with the Regions and other stakeholders to understand customer feedback, markets dynamics and demands on spare parts as well as competitive landscape. Give input on spare parts opportunities and threats to relevant stakeholders Continuously forecasting and planning demand of spare parts sales for the industry in close cooperation (liaison function) with the regions and Global Supply Chain on relevant actions and improvements and with globally agreed standards and practices Focusing on reliable availability and shorter cycle times from quote to delivery, with optimal stock levels and focus on the optimal balance of customer needs and cost of capital, in line with global strategy and guidelines Securing customer requirements are turned into optimal stocking strategy for the industry, and balanced across the regions, by agreed standards and agreements between Global Service and Global Supply Chain Continuously work on improvements in availability with accurate demand planning and forecasting Collecting, process and share feedback on the market situation in relation to competitiveness, like pirates, pricing and customer demand to relevant stakeholders within Marel About you Good understanding and experience of Service business in general and spare parts business in particular Proactive and highly organized specialist with a fundamental understanding of forecasting in a high demanding aftermarket environment where machine uptime is critical. Very strong analytical skills and ability to process and consolidate data into meaningful reports in mainstream reporting and analytics tools Degree in Engineering or Logistics or matching work experience. Excellent written & spoken English. Project management, Lean, Six Sigma or similar certification preferred. Analytical, process-driven, project-oriented, relations and networking driven and strong communication skills. Spare parts, logistics or warehouse management in a B2B environment. 3+ years’ experience working in an International Corporation preferred. We offer We offer you the opportunity to develop yourself. This starts on you first day. You will receive an extensive, well-prepared onboarding period, followed by a function-specific development track of one year. You will be guided by our organization and an experienced coworker, that will teach you the specialist knowledge of our advanced equipment. On an annual basis, you will create a personal development plan so your professional and personal development are always top of mind. Our informal culture offers you the opportunity to take your own responsibilities and show initiatives. Applying in times of Corona We created a dedicated Corona-page on our website answering all the questions that we get about applying in times of Corona. You can find it here: https://jobs.marel.com/global/en/covid

title: Ervaren Microbiologisch Analist
description: Ervaren Microbiologisch Analist Location: Boxmeer Contact: Pascal Lagendijk Job type: Temp to Perm Contact phone: +31 (0)20 406 97 50 Industry: Pharmaceutical , Life Sciences, Biotechnology, Microbiology Contact email: pascal_lagendijk@oxfordcorp.com Heb jij werkervaring in de microbiologie en ben je op zoek naar dé plek om jouw carrière en jezelf verder te ontwikkelen bij een internationaal toonaangevend bedrijf? Functieomschrijving Voor een van onze opdrachtgevers zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren laborant die ervaring heeft microbiologische testen die zich graag wil ontwikkelen binnen de microbiologie. In deze positie ben je verantwoordelijk voor het opleiden en trainen van junior collega's, verder hou je je bezig met het signaleren en opvolgen van deviaties, CAPA's en verwerken van de resultaten van kwaliteits testen. Er wordt onder strakke GMP-richtlijnen gewerkt dus ervaring met kwaliteitsystemen is een vereiste. Verantwoordelijkheden Uitvoeren van kwaliteitscontroles zoals steriliteitstesten / bioburden / toxines Trainen en opleiden van collega-laboranten en operators Invoeren van testresultaten en data-analyse/trending maken en eventueel deze beoordelen Opstellen en uitvoeren van deviaties Registreren van afwijkingen en een bijdrage leveren in troubleshooting en/of oplossingen Leveren van een bijdrage in verbeteringsprojecten Profiel Afgeronde MLO/HLO opleiding in de richting microbiologie of life sciences Enkele jaren werkervaring in de microbiologie Ervaring met elektronische data verwerking Je bent resultaatgericht, kwaliteitsbewust, initiatiefrijk, flexibel en je hebt schakelvermogen Je beschikt over goede communicatieve en sociale vaardigheden Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal Arbeidsvoorwaarden Dienstverband: Start via Oxford Global Resources (verlenging mogelijk) Salarisindicatie: van €2600 tot €3000 Euro per maand Werktijden: 40 uur per week Regio: Oost-Brabant Vacaturenummer: 16997 Imporatant note; Residence permit is required. Please do not apply if you do not have a residence permit to live and work in the Netherlands. Your application will not be processed Oxford Global Resources is het grootste recruitmentbureau binnen de vakgebieden Science, Engineering en IT. Al onze recruiters hebben zelf een relevante achtergrond binnen deze gebieden en helpen je graag bij het vinden van de perfecte baan in ons uitgebreide netwerk. Als gespecialiseerde partij hebben wij een groot aanbod aan laboratorium vacatures op het gebied van Quality Control (QC) en Research &Development (R&D) binnen diverse sectoren, waaronder de Farmaceutische industrie, Biotechnologie, Contract Manufacturing, Contract Research, Voedingsmiddelenindustrie, Chemie, Milieu en Plantensector. Oxford is altijd op zoek naar talent met expertise op het gebied van Biotechnologie, Immunologie, Biochemie, Virologie, Microbiologie, Moleculaire Biologie, Life Science, Analytische Chemie, Fysische Chemie, Polymeerchemie, Petrochemie en Diagnostiek. Wij komen graag in contact met kandidaten die ervaring hebben met een of meerdere van de volgende technieken: USP (Upstream Processing) DSP (Downstream Processing), Bioprocesses, viruskweek, celkweek, ELISA, FACS, Western Blot, SDS-page, PCR, RT-PCR, qPCR, kloneren, sequencing, eiwit zuivering, purificatie, HPLC, UPLC, chromatografie, fysische chemie, viscositeit, smeltpunt, pourpoint, pH, XRF, GC, GC-MS, LC, LC-MS, ICP ICP-MS, AAS, UV, titraties, Karl Fisher, formuleren, steriliteit, determinaties, bioburden, environmental monitoring, LIMS, GMP, GLP, GCP, GDP, ISO17025. Vind je deze vacature interessant? Of ben jij op zoek naar een functie op MLO, HLO, BSc, WO, MSc of PhD en heb je interesse in de vacature laboratorium Assistent, Laborant, Laborant monstervoorbereiding, Analist, Technician, Assistant Scientist, Associate Scientist, Scientist, Manufacturing Specialist, Process Engineer, Validatie Engineer, QA (Quality Assurance) Officer, RA (Regulatory Affairs) Officer, Supervisor, Teamleider, Afdelingshoofd, Hoofd Laboratorium, Manager, Director, etc. Neem dan direct contact met ons op! Apply Now

title: Data Platform Engineer
description: Are you an experienced Data Platform Engineer who is excited by the prospect of optimising or even re-designing our company’s data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives? Then you might be our new colleague! Wherever you are in the world, we will happily help you with relocation right to the center of Amsterdam. Get in touch! Purpose We are looking for a Data Platform Engineer to join our Data Platform team. You will be responsible for our new Data Platform consisting of a Snowflake and AWS Redshift Data Warehouse and a Data Virtuality Logical Data Warehouse running on AWS EC2. With the latter it’s quick and easy to connect to different types of data sources and ingest data, without the need to code and maintain data pipelines ourselves. We’re moving from ETL to ELT (sometimes something in between) since we have Looker as our new Analytics tool. Most transformations now take place there, so less data needs to be moved around and analysts can transform most data quickly and easily themselves. You must support them in doing that and where they are not self-sufficient, build solutions for them.  Requirements Experience with and knowledge of AWS cloud services: AWS Redshift, EC2, S3. Advanced SQL knowledge; Experience building and optimising Data Warehouses, ETL/ELT processes and data sets; Strong analytic skills related to working with datasets; Build processes supporting data transformation and data structures; Agile mindset and/or experience; Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment; 3+ years of experience in a similar role; Experience/knowledge of Python is not required, but would be nice. We offer A fast-growing e-commerce environment An international office hosting over 40 nationalities Competitive compensation, relocation support and lots of benefits A social atmosphere (lunch, Friday drinks, parties, sports, etc.). To be resumed Post COVID-19! An informal, fun and driven culture A central location in one of Europe’s most vibrant cities, Amsterdam!  COVID-19 update For the safety of our employees and following the measures implemented due to COVID-19, we currently work differently. Our Amsterdam and Nijmegen offices are closed while our production facility in the Hague is operating with proper safety and health measures. Our Recruiting process is currently entirely remote via phone and video calls. Our new hires will have a remote onboarding since the well-being of our employees is our number one priority. For the time being, most of you will be working from home until further notice. This situation can change at any time.

title: Data Engineer
description: We are looking for a dynamic Data Engineer to join our growing team of infrastructure engineers and domain experts at Movares. As one of the data engineers, you will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture. You responsibilities will include wrangling data from Dutch infrastructure giants, IoT systems, and our internal teams and optimize their flow, storage, utility and discoverability. You will work closely with our software engineers, infrastructure engineers, data analysts, data scientists, and even other data engineers on data projects and initiatives. You must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems and products. The right candidate will be driven by the prospect of improving and perhaps reengineering our company’s data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives.  Je profiel Experience working with and creating modern data architectures. Proficient in Software Development (Python at least, C# is a plus). Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map-Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Kafka etc. Experience querying databases and using statistical languages: Python, SQL, etc. Experience with cloud-native development. Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using: Tableau, PowerBI, Periscope, D3, ggplot, matplotlib, seaborn, etc. Ons aanbod A challenging position for 32-40 hours at a company that focuses on the sustainable future of the Netherlands, corporate responsibility and social innovation The space to find your optimal work / private balance A permanent position Excellent secondary conditions; profit distribution, 2.5% year-end bonus and a good pension scheme (Stichting Pensioenfonds Public Transport) 36.5 vacation days based on full-time employment Owning Movares: through our unique share construction Office in the heart of Utrecht, within walking distance of Utrecht Central Station De afdeling De groep Digitale Transformatie bestaat uit circa 40 collega’s en maakt onderdeel uit van de afdeling Digitale Transformatie en IT. De uitdaging van deze groep is om de engineeringprocessen van Movares zo snel en vergaand mogelijk te automatiseren. De digitale revolutie speelt een cruciale rol in de toekomst van ons ingenieursbureau. We gebruiken steeds meer data om te inventariseren, voorspellen en vraagstukken op te lossen. Handmatige processen worden geautomatiseerd waarbij we gebruikmaken van innovatieve software. Het team is jong, gedreven en inventief. Zo kun je regelmatig deelnemen aan hackathons waarbij complexe problemen getackeld worden. Eigen initiatief en innovatieve ideeën zijn zeer welkom en noodzakelijk om elkaar steeds weer naar een hoger niveau te tillen. Werk je bij een bureau en wil je een kandidaat voorstellen? Bedankt, maar wij werven onze nieuwe collega graag zelf. Mocht dit niet lukken, dan schakelen we met bureaus waar we vaste afspraken mee hebben.

title: Security Compliance Analyst
description: DLL is not your average financial services company. In fact, we are above average in almost every way. With an employee engagement score of 85% (compared to the 72% industry average), it sure seems like we are doing something right. And, while most companies survive fewer than 20 years, 2019 marked our 50th. We collaborate with manufacturers, suppliers, and businesses in more than 30 countries to enable the acquisition of equipment, technology and software that companies need to contribute meaningfully to their communities. We believe in partnering with our customers to develop innovative and sustainable financial solutions that deliver meaningful value to the world. At DLL, we are committed to making sure that all people, regardless of their race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, physical characteristics, or mental abilities, feel welcomed and encouraged to be their authentic selves. We strive to create an inclusive environment that is reflective of the communities in which we operate. Come see what all the excitement is about. As Security Compliance Analyst, you will support DLL in two main area’s: making sure DLL is compliant with all applicable external regulations and contractual obligations regarding Information/Cyber Security and control over IT providing proof of compliance on these applicable external regulations and contractual obligations to DLLs regulators and clients. Together with your colleagues you will lead DLL to the next level on managing security compliance and providing assurance to key external stakeholders: You will assist in maintaining DLLs Information Security and IT Control Framework to ensure it covers all applicable external regulations and contractual obligations. This will require you to keep abreast of relevant external regulations regarding Information/Cyber Security and control over IT for those regions in which DLL operates. And it requires you to be able to translate these to IT and Security framework(s) used within DLL. Furthermore, you will be responsible for maintaining DLLs processes to manage security compliance and report on compliance to stakeholders. You will identify improvements in those processes where possible, to ensure efficiency and effectiveness. For instance, by guiding DLL to obtain security certification and / or periodic delivery of assurance reports (e.g. SOC2). Finally, you will coordinate the collection of evidence and prepare reporting out to regulators and clients on security compliance and level of in control over security and IT. Day to day Keep abreast of information/cyber security and data privacy laws, regulations, frameworks, contractual obligations Assist in translating these into / mapping these to DLL's information/cyber security policies, standards, control framework and procedures. Maintain and improve DLLs processes to manage security compliance and report on compliance to stakeholders. Keep abreast of and plan security compliance assessments to be reported out to regulators, clients and other key external stakeholders. Work together with the Information Security Officers and other staff of the Global Information Security team, to identify and assess potential security compliance gaps and advise responsible management on closure of these gaps. Coordinate cyber security assessments/audits both internal and external. Perform intake and coordination for cyber security questionnaires and coordinate the gathering of evidence for security compliance assessments. Create and operate centralized compliance dashboard to be used by local and global compliance teams to show the status of security compliance. And include performance data to monitor and measure productivity of the teams' remediation progress in case of deficiencies. Develop a path to DLL getting an independent cyber security certification (ISO 27001, SOC or some other) which is frequently requested by our customers and prospective customers. “We not only live up to the expectations of our customers for today, but also anticipate their market needs of tomorrow.” Essentials Academic level with 4-10 years of experience in a similar role Relevant education/certification of Information Security Management (e.g. CISM, CISSP, CISA) Proven track record in IT Governance, Risk and Compliance (IT GRC), Information Security and IT Auditing, preferable complemented with Operational Security experience Substantial knowledge of Information Security and IT Risk standards and frameworks: e.g. ISO27001/2, COBIT, NIST CSF, NIST 800-53, SOX, PCI-DSS, ISF Standards of Good Practice, SWIFT, ENISA, etc. Substantial knowledge of Information Security assurance products: e.g. ISAE3402 / SOC-reporting, ISO27001 certification, etc. Knowledge of international, country, federal and state cyber security and data privacy regulations: e.g. European Central Bank (ECB), Dutch Central Bank (DNB), NYDFS Cybersecurity Regulation, FFIEC, GDPR, CCPA, HIPAA, Brazilian Internet Act, PIPEDA, CCPA, GLBA, FCRA, RFPA, CAN-SPAM, State Data Breach Laws, California Financial Information Privacy Act, etc. Proficient and experienced with IT GRC-tooling, preferably with RSA Archer. Excellent business English (both spoken and written) Strong communication, planning and organization skills Strong influence, negotiation, persuasion and organizational sensitivity skills Quality driven and results oriented Strong analytical skills and able to think in concepts, frameworks, risks, control objectives, but keeping an eye and details and implementation. A strong team player who significantly contributes to the DLL environment Proficient with collaboration tools that support virtual and in-person meetings Ability to work from home remotely/independently and in a virtual team environment Settling in At DLL, we consider our people our biggest asset. That’s why you’ll be treated as a member, not just an employee. Together we create an informal, but professional atmosphere that is hard to find elsewhere. We also encourage members to seek out the best skills across all our offices, because the more networked we are as an organization, the more effective we can be at seeing more than a customer, and working harder as a partner. All members enjoy Two working days per year volunteering for a local charity Health and Wellness program including healthy food, fresh Coffee Plaza, free health checks, fun health & vitality activities Flexible hours with possibility to work from home (within job scope) Career development opportunities: online learning, member development programs Company pension scheme and attractive collective insurance package Employee Benefits Budget for commuting costs, extra hours of leave, pension savings, etc. DLL’s wellbeing ambition is to educate, equip, and empower members to build connections, manage their mental, emotional, physical, and financial wellness, and maintain balance between work and the other priorities that make up their lives. Our four wellbeing categories are as follows: Connection – Build meaningful connections with other members Health – Manage mental, emotional, and physical health Finance – Provide learning opportunities to help members achieve personal financial health Lifestyle – Maintain balance between work and life priorities These are the things that matter to our members and the wellbeing of our members matters to DLL! DLL in a nutshell DLL is a global vendor finance company with more than EUR 30 billion in assets. Founded in 1969 and headquartered in Eindhoven, the Netherlands, DLL provides asset-based financial solutions in the Agriculture, Food, Healthcare, Clean Technology, Construction, Transportation, Industrial, Office Equipment and Technology industries. DLL partners with equipment manufacturers, dealers and distributors in more than 30 countries to support their distribution channels and help grow their businesses. DLL combines customer focus with deep industry knowledge to deliver sustainable solutions for the complete asset life cycle, including commercial finance, retail finance and used equipment finance. DLL is a wholly owned subsidiary of Rabobank Group. To learn more about DLL, visit www.dllgroup.com. Good to know Deadline for applications: March 14th Reporting to Manager Security Governance The selection process may involve an assessment. Applications via email will not be reviewed. Please apply online via our career website DLL’s referral program applies For more information, you can contact Willem Hessels, Talent Acquisition Partner via willem.hessels@dllgroup.com DLL is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation in accordance with our values and all applicable legislation. DLL appreciates the time you spend applying to our openings. We advise only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted. Hiring is subject to successful completion of a background verification and integrity check. Almost all members of DLL in NL are required to take the Bankers Oath. Banks in the Netherlands find it important that everyone working in the Dutch banking environment fulfills their role with integrity and care. The Banker’s Oath is our promise that we will do so with our customers, the society and to each other. Screening is part of the application procedure and DLL screens all interns and new employees according to the “DLL Global Screening Policy” in order to ascertain whether the applicant may hold a position at DLL.

title: Junior Cloud Solution Architect
description: We are looking for a highly motivated and passionate Junior Data Platform & Advanced Analytics Cloud Solution Architect to support in driving high priority customer initiatives on the Microsoft Azure Platform. This is a customer facing role, supporting the overall technical relationship with the customer on Microsoft Data, Advanced Analytics and Artificial Intelligence Platform. You own Data Platform & Advanced Analytics technical customer engagements including architectural design sessions, specific implementation projects and/or pilots. The ideal candidate has experience in a customer-facing role and deep technical discussions with Data Engineers, Data Analysts and/or Developers to drive Data Platform and Advanced Analytics solutions to production. Responsibilities Key responsibilities include: Understand customers’ overall data estate. Apply technical knowledge to architect solutions that meet business and IT needs. Understand Data Platform Strategies and Advanced Analytics roadmaps to ensure long term technical viability of new deployments, infusing key big data, analytics and AI technologies where appropriate (e.g. Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory, Azure ML, ML Server, Big Data, Data Lake, Azure Databricks, etc.). Ensure all solutions exhibit high levels of performance, security, scalability, maintainability, and appropriate reusability and reliability upon deployment. Develop deep relationships with key customer Engineers, Analysts, and Architects to enable them to be cloud specialists. Collaborate with Senior Cloud Solution Architects in developing complex end-to-end Enterprise solutions on Microsoft Azure platform. Share insights to remove key blockers. Maintain technical skills and knowledge; collaborate and share with the technical community within Microsoft and customers on Azure platform. Qualifications Required 1-5 years of professional experience Capabilities in relationship building, problem solving, collaboration Technical experience with cloud and/or hybrid platforms Subject matter expertise in one or more of the following Data Platform Cloud solutions: SQL including OSS (Postgress, MySQL etc), Azure SQL NoSQL Databases including OSS (Maria DB, Mongo DB, etc), Cosmos DB Big Data including SQL DW, Snowflake, Big Query, Redshift Advanced Analytics including Azure Databricks, visualization tools as PowerBI, Tableau Data Governance Data estate workloads like HDInsight, Hadoop, Cloudera, Spark, Python  Preferred Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineer or similar Certification in one or more of the following technologies: Cloud, mobile, Database, Big Data, BI, Data Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence Demonstrated self-learner of new technologies and understands relevant cloud trends. Competitive Landscape: Knowledge of cloud development platforms.  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

title: Business Analyst
description: We are looking for a strong business analyst that loves the large amounts of useful e-commerce data we have in our platform.  Core Responsibilities :  Understand and analyze business opportunities and processes and come up with analysis using Data Analytics platforms like PowerBI, Tableau or similar Developing Visual Reports, Dashboards and KPI scorecards using BI Tools. Convert data into digestible business intelligence and actionable information. Use analytical and statistical rigor to uncover potential for clients, answer business questions and drive business decisions.  Key Skills : 5+ years of experience as an analyst or engineer in Data/BI space Strong problem-solving and analytical skills Experience working directly with business stakeholders to translate business requirements to needs from data and analytics Experience with BI tools like Power BI, Google Data Studio or Tableau is must. Strong experience with SQL and big data storage like BigQuery, Redshift or Azure Synapse Connecting to data sources to import data and transforming data for business intelligence. Experience with statistical analysis. Ability to constantly ensure data quality Good interpersonal and communication skills. Be self-driven and ability to deal with ambiguity in terms of incomplete data.  Nice to Have : Experience with APIs Experience with Python or other general-purpose languages to collect data from diverse sources E-commerce experience will help in knowing what insights are useful  What is ChannelEngine? ChannelEngine is a fast-growing SaaS solution, offering leading brands, distributors and retailers of all industries a solution to connect their systems to most important international Marketplaces and sales channels while optimizing sales, minimizing time and maximizing profit and reach. ChannelEngine's story began in 2013 when it became undeniable that marketplaces were going to be one of the most important elements of the global e-commerce market. We saw an opportunity to make these powerful platforms available to any business. Our 15+ years of e-commerce experience helped us build the most complete marketplace management suite and now, 7 years later, we facilitate the sale of over 6 million products from 2000 brands to over 100 marketplaces. Our platform is used by many strong and well-known companies. Some of the many great names we work for are JBL, Bugaboo, Brabantia, Brunotti, Hunkemöller, RB (Finish, Airwick, Durex, Nurofen), Body & Fit, Nelson, Libbey, Signify, Staples, Polaroid, and many more. ChannelEngine is growing at an extremely rapid pace and currently covers Channels in Europe, US, Canada and Mexico and is currently on a mission to cover the globe. Do you like change and innovation? Are you looking for high energy and driven people to work with and achieve ambitious goals together while having fun? Are you ready to grow with us? Don’t hesitate to send in your application!

title: IT Business Analyst
description: IT Business Analyst  Location: The Netherlands / Europe / UK / remote Fulltime Permanent contract / Temporary hiring.  The Job: The IT Business Analyst role requires a combination of first class analysis and document writing skills, combined strong knowledge of the logistics / supply chain industry. The role is primarily concerned with activities related to the on-site deployment and modification of logistics systems, principally: Blue Yonder (formerly JDA) Dispatcher Warehouse Management System The client’s own in-house Transport Management Systems Tibco Middleware Tool We take a structured approach to system delivery, and the Business Analyst undertakes a prominent role in all stages, as outlined in the BA Activities section below. Your responsibilities? Our IT BA’s are required to clearly define the Business Requirements (“AS-IS” and “TO-BE”) in writing, and then determine how the system/s selected will be used to meet the requirements (including identifying any changes). They are effectively the project “owner” of the system solution and are responsible for the IT solution meeting the agreed business requirements. Our IT BA’s lead workshops to elicit the business and systems requirements and clearly document those requirements to current templates / standards, through a combination of diagramming and clear, concise, business English. They ensure that all changes / functional specifications meet the business stated requirements, and where necessary define the interface mappings or functionality changes required (the “what”, but not the technical details of “how” they would be achieved – this would be performed by the relevant application teams / providers). Working with the our Tester / Test Manager the BA will work to support them in defining the relevant test cases and conditions, define test data needed and write the necessary test scripts for functional and then integration testing (often performed with the client). The IT BA will perform a handover of the project to an IT Implementer, informing them of all relevant information required to support the project through the Go-live and post implementation periods. Requirements: 4PL / 3PL Experience The IT Business Analysts have 3 to 5 years experience within the IT Department of a logistics / supply chain organisation. Alternatively they have similar experience in the logistics team / department of a retail or industrial organisation. Warehouse / Transport / Supply Chain Experience A proven track record of both Operational and Systems knowledge, with very strong operational knowledge WMS / TMS experience. General Skills First class analytical skills are required, and the ability to create process flows and write clear concise documents is essential. Strong communication skills (written and verbal) are also essential, as is experience of running workshops, and testing software. About G-Nius G-Nius is a project-based consultancy company, specialized in Energy & Utilities, IT Logistics & Warehouse Management Services and ICT infrastructure. If you're interested in this vacancy or if you want to recieve more information, please contact Marcel Roestenberg via mroestenberg@g-nius.nl or call: +31 (0) 6 46923674

title: FINANCE CONSULTANT ONDERWIJS
description: 28 januari 2021 by Dewi Hollander Al jaren staat het onderwijs voor grote uitdagingen. De kwaliteit van het onderwijs moet omhoog en tegelijkertijd moet er worden bezuinigd. Daarnaast is er sprake van een dreigend leraren tekort als gevolg van de vergrijzing. Jij gaat als finance consultant – onderwijs het verschil maken voor huidige en toekomstig docenten en leerlingen: door op projectbasis financieel inzicht te bieden en met sterke implementaties werkende oplossingen te creëren in deze onmisbare sector. WAT JE DOET ALS FINANCE CONSULTANT – ONDERWIJS Je ondersteunt en adviseert onze onderwijsklanten, zoals de Haagse Hogeschool, Universiteit van Leiden en ROC Amasterdam. Dat kan bijvoorbeeld binnen de expertises Business Control, Financial Control, Project Control en Data Analytics & Reporting. Je kent de onderwijssector, haar uitdagingen, processen en cultuur goed en weet hierdoor welke (niet-) financiële data relevant is voor het opstellen van betrouwbare managementinformatie. Zo adviseer je bijvoorbeeld als Business Controller het management en de onderwijsprofessionals en stel je de begroting en verschillende business cases op. In bijvoorbeeld de rol van Financial Controller help je onze opdrachtgevers met het opstellen van de meest complexe jaarrekeningen en de begroting of ondersteun je bij het optimaliseren van het facturatieproces. Daarnaast zijn er op dit moment ook opdrachten binnen het onderwijs op het gebied van projectcontrol. De Rijksoverheid heeft diverse subsidies opengesteld voor het onderwijs. Deze subsidies zijn opengesteld omdat door de corona crisis het onderwijs onder enorme druk staat. Denk hierbij aan subsidies op het gebied van kwaliteit van het onderwijs en hulp voor de klas. Als projectcontroller kan je bij BAS aan de slag bij een scholengemeenschap om de subsidieverantwoording voor de scholen in orde te maken zodat zij op de juiste wijze de verantwoording kunnen indienen en tijdig de subsidie in ontvangst mogen nemen. Een opdracht waarbij je je rapportage skills kan combineren met je socials skills omdat het natuurlijk belangrijk is goed in contact te komen met de juiste managers binnen de scholen om de juiste informatie te verzamelen voor de verantwoording. WAAROM JIJ HET VERSCHIL KUNT MAKEN Jouw expertise is keihard nodig bij onderwijsinstellingen, want zij staan als gevolg van de vergrijzing, COVID-9 en bezuinigingen voor grote uitdagingen. Je hebt een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding in een financiële richting zoals bedrijfseconomie of accountancy of vergelijkbare relevante opleiding. Daarnaast heb je tenminste 2 jaar relevante werkervaring binnen een onderwijsinstelling (VO, MBO, HBO of WO). Bijvoorbeeld in de rol van junior controller, assistent controller, financial analyst, (grootboek-)administrateur, financial controller of business controller. Je bent in staat complexe projecten van a-z neer te zetten en tegelijkertijd daarin verschillende rollen aan te nemen; soms als strategisch partner, soms help je bij de praktische uitvoering. Als onderwijsfinancial vind jij het leuk om als extra verantwoordelijkheid onze consultants op een boeiende manier mee te nemen in jouw onderwijscasussen en help je ze op weg binnen de onderwijssector. Je voelt je comfortabel bij spreken in het openbaar en jij kan je zowel in woord en schrift uitstekend uiten in het Nederlands. Je droomt weleens over het werken als zelfstandige, maar vindt de zekerheid van een vaste baan erg fijn. Jij wilt als ondernemende financial graag door ontwikkelen als toekomstbestendige finance professional in het onderwijs door kennis te maken met verschillende projecten, opdrachtgevers en bedrijfsculturen. Je hebt een groot aanpassingsvermogen en stelt je flexibel op aan veranderende omstandigheden. WAT WIJ JOU BIEDEN Naast toegang tot een groot & sterk netwerk, en werken aan afwisselende opdrachten bij mooie opdrachtgevers ontvang jij als Finance Consultant Onderwijs ook: Een brutosalaris dat kan oplopen tot € 6.000,- per maand. Dit is afhankelijk van de kennis en ervaring die jij meebrengt. Aantrekkelijke bonussen, waaronder de bonus die wordt berekend op basis van het aantal declarabele uren. Overuren worden 140% uitbetaald. Maar maak ze niet te veel, want een goede werk-privébalans is belangrijk. Opleidingsbudget van € 6.000,- per jaar dat je kunt besteden aan het opleidingsinstituut Creating Insights. Mogelijkheid om een relevante post- of executive master te volgen. Of om een RC-, RA-, RE-opleiding te doen. Leaseauto (ook voor privégebruik) of een NS Business Card. Kies je voor de tweede optie, dan ontvang je van ons een bonus. Nog veel meer goede voorwaarden, zoals: een contract voor onbepaalde tijd, collectieve pensioenregeling, 25 vakantiedagen (bij een 40-urige werkweek) en als je een heel kalenderjaar niet ziek bent geweest dan krijg je 5 vakantiedagen extra. Met regelmaat gezellige (online) bedrijfsuitjes en borrels. DIT MAG JIJ VERWACHTEN VAN BAS CONSULTANCY Tussen de opdrachten en bedrijven door zien we je graag op ons kantoor in Den Haag. Een gezellig, warm hoofdkantoor aan de karakteristieke Benoordenhoutseweg in Den Haag waar je altijd welkom bent en iedereen blij is om je te zien; Bij BAS Consultancy gaat het er niet alleen om wie je bent, maar vooral om wie je wilt worden. Dat is precies waar onze HR Business Partner Vera ‘in the picture’ komt. Met haar stel je een persoonlijk ontwikkelplan op, met oog op de laatste ontwikkelingen binnen het vakgebied én de nodige soft skills. Via het opleidingsinstituut Creating Insights volg je diverse trainingen op het gebied van FinTech, Data, Actualiteiten, Privacy & Security en Consultancy vaardigheden. Je komt terecht in een persoonlijke, ondernemende en betrokken organisatie. Op onze borrels, trainingen of gezellige uitjes kom je met regelmaat jouw mede BAS consultant tegen. We werken nauw met elkaar samen. Zo heb jij veel contact met onze afdelingen HR, Accountmanagement en Finance. Ook organiseren we regelmatig inloopavonden en visiebijeenkomsten met onze oprichter Peter Arensman om jouw mening en ideeën over bepaalde onderwerpen te horen. SOLLICITATIEPROCEDURE Interesse? Dan leren wij jou graag kennen. Solliciteren kan via de button. Heb je nog vragen over de functie, arbeidsvoorwaarden of ons bedrijf? Bel, app of mail met Francis Meskers, onze Talent Acquisition Specialist. 06- 20 00 00 29 | francis.meskers@basconsultancy.nl

title: MICROBIOLOGISCH ANALIST LEVENSMIDDELEN 20-40 UUR (MLO/HLO)
description: Functieomschrijving Als Microbiologisch Analist ben je een belangrijk onderdeel van een klantgerichte organisatie. Op basis van de kwaliteit van jouw werk worden bij klanten belangrijke beslissingen genomen. De missie van Normec Foodlab is door het leveren van snelle en correcte data en een persoonlijk contact de 'kwaliteitscollega' van de klant te zijn. Met jouw werk bepaal jij voor een groot deel de klantervaring. Samen met een gezellig en positief ingesteld team van ongeveer 40 collega's ben je verantwoordelijk voor alle microbiologische en aanverwante onderzoeken van diverse levensmiddelen. Een allround analistenfunctie, waarin je in de middag en avond actief bent binnen alle facetten van het primaire proces.  Binnen deze functie behoren de volgende werkzaamheden tot je takenpakket: Het zorgdragen voor een juiste monstervoorbehandeling Het uitvoeren van de meest voorkomende microbiologische analyses, zoals algemeen kiemgetal, pathogenen (bijvoorbeeld Listeria monocytogenes en Salmonella SPP), sporenvorming. Een correcte verwerking van de analysedata naar interne werkformulieren Naleving van de werkvoorschriften en procedures, o.a. volgens ISO17025 Juist en tijdig aanleveren van de analysedata in het registratiesysteem LIMS "Een mooie vacature van allround analist, waarin je actief bent binnen alle facetten van het primaire laboratoriumproces." Functie-eisen De Microbiologisch Analist die wij zoeken voelt zich thuis in een hectische omgeving, werkt nauwkeurig, helpt graag zijn of haar collega's en heeft een servicegerichte instelling.  Verder herken jij je in de volgende punten: Een afgeronde mlo/hlo opleiding richting Microbiologie, Levensmiddelentechnologie of een aanverwante opleiding Minimaal stage ervaring met het uitvoeren van (klassieke) microbiologische analyses bij voorkeur als laborant in een productieomgeving Je bent bekend met het kwaliteitssysteem ISO 17025 Je beheerst de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift Flexibiliteit met betrekking tot werktijden is noodzakelijk. Bereidheid om in de avonden en weekenden te werken is een must Aanbod Normec Foodlab bied je een verantwoordelijke functie met een breed takenpakket, waarbij jouw werk van wezenlijk belang is voor het succes van de organisatie. Geen dag is hetzelfde!  Er is voldoende ruimte om extra taken op te nemen als je wat meer ervaring hebt. Zo kan je betrokken worden bij validaties, optimalisaties, ringtesten, testen van nieuwe media of het oplossen van OOC's. Zowel starters als meer ervaren analisten worden dan ook uitgenodigd om te solliciteren!  Wat mag jij verder verwachten van Normec Foodlab: Je komt terecht in een groeiende en stabiele organisatie Je ontvangt in beginsel een tijdelijk contract met uitzicht op een vast dienstverband Je hebt de mogelijkheid om parttime te werken Je ontvangt een salaris tussen de €1800 en €2500 bruto per maand gebaseerd op een fulltime dienstverband en is mede afhankelijk van jouw opgedane werkervaring Je ontvangt 25 vakantiedagen + 8 % vakantietoeslag Er is een pensioenregeling, 1/3 werknemer 2/3 werkgever Er wordt geïnvesteerd in persoonlijke begeleiding en relevante opleidingen en trainingen

title: Assistant Vice President, ETL Developer
description: Would you like to work for one of the World's largest banks in an exciting, dynamic and international environment? We are currently searching for a Assistant Vice President, DWH - ETL Developer for our MDS team as part of the Systems Division in Amsterdam. MUFG Bank Europe N.V. (MBE) is a fully-owned subsidiary of Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), one of the largest ranked Financial Groups in the world in terms of assets. A world-class set of businesses and more than 180,000 employees in 50 markets. MUFG offers stability in an ever-changing market, providing services to high-profile clients worldwide. For more than 50 years MBE offers commercial banking services to both Japanese and non-Japanese corporate customers in The Netherlands and, through its branches, in Central and East Europe. The goal is to be among the top performing foreign-owned banks operating in The Netherlands, providing value-added banking services and excellent operations, fulfilling both Japanese and non-Japanese customers' needs. The MBE subsidiary based in The Netherlands is a growing network of branches, managed from Amsterdam. Our vision? To become the world’s most trusted financial group. You’ll help us achieve it. Purpose of the function The position is open in the MBE Data Store (MDS) team of the IT delivery department. MDS is a strategic asset of the MUFG Bank Europe being aimed to accumulate and process bank’s information for both reporting to regulators and supporting internal business processes. DWH / ETL developer will work closely with the Solution/ Data Architect to design, build interfaces and integrate data from a variety from internal and external data sources into the Enterprise Data Warehouse environment with the use of MS SQL SSIS. The ETL Developer will be responsible for developing ETL primarily utilizing Microsoft technologies within industry recognized ETL standards, architecture and best practices. Responsibilities Act as a technical expert in the designing, coding, testing, supporting and debugging of new software or significant enhancement to existing software Troubleshoot and debug ETL jobs and creating unit tests for ETL jobs. Assess query performance and actively contribute to optimizing the code Develop stored procedures when needed Write technical documentation and specifications Work with DBAs and Data Architects to plan and implement best ETL strategies Work with business systems analysts to create technical design specifications, gaining a sound understanding of business processes for related applications so that integration processes fulfill the end-user requirements Create a solution following the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) Communicate with Business Analysts to understand requirements, socialize ideas among peers, and document work product Support internal audit by submitting required evidences Qualifications: Proven work experience as an ETL Developer Expert level of knowledge of Microsoft SQL services and technologies (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS and SQL Server 2012+) Experience with MS Visual Studio Experience in BIML development Experience in SQL; Strong SQL scripting knowledge, able to create complex SQL queries Good working knowledge of at least one scripting language (Bash, Python or Perl) is an advantage Advanced knowledge of relational databases Demonstrated knowledge of data warehouse concepts (data normalization, star schema, etc) Good understanding of physical and logical data modelling Ability to troubleshoot and solve complex technical problems Good understanding of software development best practises Working experience in Agile projects Experience in working in high priority projects (high pressure on delivery) Some flexibility outside 9-5 working hours Able to communicate complex information clearly and concisely. Able to work independently and also to collaborate across the organization Highly developed problem-solving skills with minimal supervision Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English Competencies Integrity and Responsibility Balance Risk with Opportunity Customer Focus Demonstrate Global Perspective Professionalism and Teamwork Drive For Results Collaborate and Build Partnerships Communicate Effectively and Professionally Challenge Ourselves To Grow Influence and Inspire Others Lead Change & Seek Continuous Improvement Think Strategically We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and committed to leveraging the diverse backgrounds, perspectives and experience of our workforce to create opportunities for our colleagues and our business. We do not discriminate in employment decisions on the basis of any protected category. Language skills Verbal and written communication skills in English are essential.

title: Senior RFP Writer
description: RFP’s are our most direct form of marketing and are crucial in the decision making by our clients. You will therefore be an essential part of the team driving NNIP's business development efforts. Your impact as RFP Writer at NN With your critical eye, you confidently dive deep into the high waves of the financial world. You know exactly what the ins and outs of the industry are. From Due Diligence Questionnaires to a Request for Proposals; you can convert complex material into razor-sharp, watertight documents with which you convince customers to invest at NN Investment Partners. You write clearly and precisely, but also with irrefutable authority and expertise. You tell the customer exactly how the issues surrounding risk and compliance work. This gives prospective clients the confidence to trust and work with NN IP. Your responsibilities Manage Requests For Proposals and Due Diligence Questionnaires, ensuring accuracy, timeliness, and consistency of company-level language in all responses Producing high quality responses, identifying key "win" themes and positioning responses for each request Collaborate with Subject Matter Experts throughout the firm to create accurate responses and to develop sales narrative Commit to improving the efficiency of the RFP process and quality of RFP submissions Build an in-depth understanding of the firm's product offerings and investment capabilities Who you are You are passionate about the information you share with clients. Your own personal interest in the profession drives you to follow the latest developments in the financial sector. You are comfortable working closely with various internal stakeholders and competing priorities. You are able to work under pressure and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Evidence of success in related field of at least 3 – 5 years, including but not limited to RFP writing, editing, consultant relations, institutional sales, client service, marketing, financial news, journalism, technical writing Organized and detail-oriented with strong time management skills and ability to prioritize multiple deadlines Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills Self-starter with proven initiative and ability to work independently and as part of a broader team Bachelor’s degree or equivalent Your colleagues You are part of the RFP Services & Investment marketing team, which is part of the marketing department within NN Investment Partners and is responsible for the commercial positioning of our investment strategies and of different capabilities of NN IP as whole and deals with high quality Request for Proposals and Due Diligence Questionnaires from international prospects & clients with the aim to contribute to the commercial success of the organization. The team consists of 10 professionals: six RFP/DDQ writers, two Data Analysts and two Investment Marketers. Continue developing It is important to us that you continue to develop yourself. We give you the space and the confidence to grow in your career as well as a person. We help you with: Plenty of training and learning opportunities in our Learning & Development Centre A large (international) network of colleagues who are keen to share their knowledge with you The autonomy to set out your own development path About NN We help people care for what matters most to them. The world in which we live may change, but what really matters to people remains the same. Family, friends, love, health, home and of course work. You help to make our services more personal and relevant. As an organisation we can really make a difference with all our brands: Nationale-Nederlanden, NN Investment Partners, ABN AMRO Verzekeringen, Movir, AZL, BeFrank, Zicht and OHRA. NN Investment Partners was formed in July 1994, domiciled in The Netherlands. Our successful asset management history, however, dates back 170 years to our rich heritage as a Dutch insurer and commercial bank. NN IP is the asset manager of NN Group N.V., a publicly traded company listed on Euronext Amsterdam. NN Group is an international insurance and asset management company, active in 18 countries, with a strong presence in a number of European countries and Japan. With all our employees the Group offers retirement services, pensions, insurance, investments and banking to approximately 17 million customers. With around 1,000 employees and active in 15 countries across Europe, U.S., Latin America, Asia and Middle East, NN IP provides clients access to domestic, regional and global investment solutions. The extensive scope of NN IP enables us to offer globally a wide variety of investment solutions complemented by best-in-class service. NN IP has EUR 295.4 bln under management (as of September 2020). Employee benefits You are more than a colleague and we understand that very well at NN. You have different roles in life and that involves choices. We give you the opportunity to select the employee benefits that are important to you and that match your personal situation. This includes buying additional leave, flexible working hours or working four nine-hour days. Your holiday allowance and 13th month are paid with your salary monthly, so there is no need to wait. Because of coronavirus, all NN colleagues are currently working from home fully digitally. It is currently not yet clear when we can return to the office. The official location for this job is The Hague. Will you be our new colleague? If you are enthusiastic about this vacancy and think that you would be a good fit for the team at NN, we would like to invite you to apply. We are very keen to find out who you are, what motivates you and what you can contribute to this role at NN. Apply now If you have any questions about the vacancy or the process, give us a call or let us know on WhatsApp. You can reach out to Elise Kapper (Recruiter) via +31 (0)6 14682729 or via elise.kapper@nn.nl. This is a permanent position. A candidate will receive a contract from NN and we are not open to interim/freelance assignments and/or candidates or recruitment agencies. Thank you very much for your understanding.

title: Financial Analyst
description: 2+ years of experience in a highly analytical role within a fast-paced metrics driven environment Demonstrated ability to build and manage financial models Ability to perform complex analysis and simplify its communication Advanced computer literacy (MS Excel, SQL/other Database) Bachelor's in finance, economics, computer science, mathematics, statistics Fluent in English Since launching its first European websites in 1998, Amazon has grown into a global leader in e-commerce, with customer-facing websites selling physical goods across many European geographies, including in The Netherlands as of 2020. We are currently looking for a highly analytical and self-motivated Financial Analyst to join our Amazon Netherlands Finance team in Amsterdam.  The Financial Analyst will contribute to reporting, planning and control processes, as well as drive independent analysis to improve business features and visibility into results. In this role, you will partner closely business and cross-functional teams (Operations, Transportation, Marketing, Accounting, etc.) to deliver on growth initiatives and financial commitments. This role will be fast paced, thought provoking, but most of all extremely rewarding as we realize tangible results from our efforts to continuously delight customers.  Core Responsibilities Include: Ensure financial controls/processes are in place and respected through continuous audit, reporting and systems implementation Partner and communicate actively with business partners to manage and develop daily, weekly and monthly financial controllership rhythms Establish, maintain and improve operating and business metrics and dashboards to improve accuracy and pace of decision making Build short and long-term financial plans Partnering with business teams to calculate and understand financial trade-offs of key business decisions, while providing strategic recommendations Develop end-to-end business cases supporting growth initiatives, and presenting to leadership Using data to perform root cause analysis to provide improvement plans Excellent analytical skills, a passion for metrics and data, and the ability to get into the details, while also seeing and understanding the big picture Ability to meet tight deadlines, prioritize workload and achieve effective results in a fast-paced, dynamic, ever-growing and often ambiguous environment Strong interpersonal skills including written and oral communication

title: Business Analist
description: Omschrijving Een belangrijke rol binnen Pipelife waarbij je midden in de organisatie staat. Jij bent de brug tussen de directeur en het management team binnen Pipelife. Een belangrijke schakelrol waar veel personen in de organisatie afhankelijk van zijn.  Over de functie Een brede functie waar de focus ligt op de strategische ontwikkeling met gedegen informatie en analyses en daarmee de winstgevende groei ondersteunen. Jij gaat je o.a. richten op de volgende zaken. Het aanleveren van analyses aan het management gericht op markttendensen, concurrentie, productbehoeften en serviceontwikkeling. Marktonderzoek met deskresearch en fieldresearch. Aanvullend aan sales controlling: scenario’s doorrekenen voor de winstgevendheid van mogelijke producten, service ontwikkelingen en bedrijfsuitbreiding. Voorstellen ontwikkelen ter verbetering of aanpassing van commerciële processen. Bijdragen aan toevoegingen aan sales controlling dashboard op basis van de strategische inzichten.  Vereisten Een onafhankelijke en uitdagende functie binnen een innovatief bedrijf waar men samen een mooi product produceert. Je brengt behoeften, wensen en eisen vanuit de organisatie in kaart. Hierdoor is het belangrijk dat jij minimaal 2/3 jaar ervaring hebt in een vergelijkbare rol. Om deze functie tot een succes te maken beschik jij over WO werk- en denkniveau met als achtergrond bedrijfseconomie/bedrijfskunde. Jij voelt je thuis in een dynamische omgeving en werkt resultaatgericht. Om bedrijfsprocessen en informatiestromen en behoeftes te analyseren en om te kunnen zetten in bruikbare informatie en concrete plannen, beschik jij over een sterk analytisch vermogen. Je bent qua ontwikkeling continu in beweging, geen dag is hetzelfde. Hierdoor is het belangrijk dat jij je continu kunt aanpassen aan veranderende situaties en speelt hierop direct in. In deze fulltime functie past een Business Analist die de behoefte en ambitie heeft om te blijven leren en uiteindelijk door te kunnen groeien.  Pipelife produceert en levert een compleet assortiment kunststof leidingsystemen, hulpstukken en intelligente oplossingen op maat. Wij verankeren en verstevigen onze leiderspositie door in te zetten op duurzaamheid, toepasbaarheid en installatiegemak. Dankzij de samenwerking met onze klanten en ons ervaren en gedreven team van experts verleggen we continu grenzen en ontwikkelen we vernieuwende producten en systemen. Zo dragen we actief bij tot de duurzame distributie van water, energie en data. Wij zijn gevestigd in Enkhuizen en Pipelife Nederland telt ruim 280 medewerkers en behoort tot de Pipelife Group, onderdeel van Wienerberger AG. De Pipelife Group heeft 26 vestigingen in Europa en de VS en ruim 2.600 medewerkers. Het hoofdkantoor is gevestigd in Wenen, Oostenrijk.  Wat wij bieden Uitstekende arbeidsvoorwaarden Ontwikkelmogelijkheden Een dynamische, onafhankelijke functie in een vrije rol. Ondernemend en hoog gemotiveerd team waarin je een belangrijke bijdrage kan leveren. Herken jij jezelf in bovenstaand profiel en ben jij gedreven, ambitieus en resultaatgericht en ga jij een flinke uitdaging niet uit de weg, dan nodigen wij je uit om te solliciteren. Stuur je C.V. met je motivatie naar Belinda Esvelt, Recruiter naar Belinda.Esvelt@pipelife.com. Of bel voor informatie 06-51024516.

title: Operational Compliance Analyst
description: LIFE AT IMC AS OPERATIONAL COMPLIANCE ANALYST WHO WE ARE AND WHAT WE DO IMC is a leading global market maker, using algorithmic trading and advanced technology to buy and sell securities on multiple trading venues worldwide. We provide liquidity to the financial markets, driving efficiencies for buyers and sellers. Founded in 1989, we are an ambitious, innovative company and identified early on the importance technology would play in the fast-paced evolution of trading. This entrepreneurial spirit still drives us today and can be found in all of our offices around the world. OUR TEAM We now operate globally from offices in Europe, the US and Asia Pacific. Our employees work closely together in multidisciplinary teams, making our success possible. Technology - At IMC, technology is not a department, it is at the heart of everything we do. Our technologists push the limits of possibility, and then look beyond. In our fast-paced environment, short feedback loops mean projects worked on in the morning can enter production the next day. Trading – Although our traders come from many backgrounds they all have one thing in common: they are at their best solving complex problems. Their insight into global events, market shifts and pricing ensure we are trading in the right place, at the right time. Business Support - Around the world, IMC’s business support teams are essential for sustaining our success. In our dynamic environment, we have many exciting challenges and multidisciplinary opportunities to shape our operations and make a real impact. OUR CULTURE Our employees are our greatest asset so we give them lots of responsibility and the support they need to make a difference. Our flat structure fosters a culture of openness and collaboration, encouraging the sharing of ideas and knowledge. It makes no difference if you have been with us for three days or three years, the best idea wins. While we work hard, we also have a lot of fun; whether solving complex challenges or in team building, leisure and sporting activities. IMC also enables its employees to contribute towards a better society through our foundation. Are you someone who is passionate about challenging the status quo? Do you enjoy the process of problem solving, a process where you recognize areas of improvement and innovate to improve? Does your curiosity and desire to learn drive you? WHAT YOU’LL DO The Compliance team operates very close to our Trading and Technology teams. Main objective of the team is to ensure our organization complies at all times with external and internal regulation. We strongly believe a strong compliance culture can only be built when employees do not only adhere to the policies and rules, but also understand the context and intent of regulation. As a Compliance Analyst at IMC you will be based directly on the dealing room of our Amsterdam office. You will assist in managing the day-to-day compliance activities, like monitoring/reporting of our trading activities and onboarding counterparties. This requires knowledge of our trading strategies, counterparties, venues and of course the regulatory landscape we operate in. To excel in this role you will be combining analytical skills with operational and system knowledge to add value, and not bureaucracy to the business. We are looking for someone who is used to working with large data sets and who has knowledge of programming languages, with a critical, proactive and hands-on approach. Your tasks will include but not be limited to: Ensure regulatory transaction reports are sent timely and accurate; Ensure trading counterparties are on-boarded and reviewed timely (AML/KYC) Monitoring and analyze intraday trading activity and discuss with our Trading Desks; Advise traders on exchange rules and regulations Assist with inquiries made by exchanges or regulators Collaborate with global compliance team members to design and enhance global standards Analyze developments within the markets we trade and identify both risks and opportunities; WHAT WE LOOK FOR: University degree (preferable) 1-3 years of relevant experience with a financial services provider Broad interest in financial markets, regulatory developments and market structure Process minded and ability to improve IMC’s control framework Advanced skills in excel and experience working with large data sets Basic knowledge of derivatives, market making and coding Strong analytical / problem solving skills; Structured and concise in communication; Ability to act and perform successfully in a fast-moving and high-pressured environment. OUR HIRING PROCESS To set you up for success, you can find our hiring process including tips on applying and interviewing with us on our website . Now it’s up to you! Apply today to start an amazing journey with IMC.

title: E-commerce analist
description: Functieomschrijving Als E-commerce analist ga jij je richten op het gehele e-commerce traject van jouw nieuwe werkgever; een internationale distribiteur van mode artikelen. Jij weet wat jullie retailpartners verlangen en je zorgt ervoor dat alle e-commerce activiteiten hier op aansluiten. De e-commerce analist werkt met interne- en externe contacten als IT, customer service, accountmanagement om klanten om het hele e-commerce traject te optimaliseren en er voor te zorgen dat alle e-commerce data constant up to date en relevant is. In de functie vind je het enerzijds het analyseren en rapporteren van data terug, maar anderzijds ook het uitvoerende als het gaat om het zijn van een contactpersoon, het inrichten van systemen en het hebben van contact met key-accounts. De e-commerce analist gaat aan de slag in een internationaal team met twee directe collega’s. Het bedrijf bevindt zich in Amsterdam en kenmerkt zich door professionaliteit, directe communicatie en korte communicatielijnen.  De functie van E-commerce analist samengevat: Het analyseren van data rondom de te distribueren producten binnen het e-commerce traject en deze aansluiten van de eisen van de retailpartners. Je bent veel in contact met internationale collega’s om er voor te zorgen dat alle data analyses en vervolgprocessen op een eenduidige manier verlopen. In samenwerking met de logistieke afdeling richt jij je op de forecasting voor key-accounts. Uiteraard houd je een scherpe focus op verbeterpunten in het e-commerce proces. Daarnaast ben je ook verantwoordelijk voor omzet, verkoop- en klantanalyses. Arbeidsvoorwaarden In eerste instantie een jaarcontract, met uitzicht op vast dienstverband. 25 vakantiedagen. Er is een maximale reiskostenvergoeding van €145,- per maand. Korting op een fitness abonnement. Ook heb je de mogelijkheid om mee te doen aan een collectieve zorgverzekering en pensioen wordt ook geregeld! Je gaat aan de slag bij een fashion bedrijf; hier horen dus ook gratis artikelen en artikelen met korting bij. Functie eisen Onze ideale kandidaat heeft ongeveer 1 tot 3 jaar werkervaring binnen een e-commerce omgeving, waarbij data analyse ook een onderdeel van jouw functie was. The positie is op hbo niveau en om jouw taken goed te kunnen uitvoeren is het van belang dat je een professionele beheersing van Excel en de Engelse taal hebt. Als persoon ben je een sterke communicator, analytisch ingesteld en iemand die denkt in oplossingen. Vragen, opmerkingen of interesse? Mail ons naar amsterdam@justinrecruitment.nl of gebruik de solliciteer knop!

title: Pricing Manager
description: Pricing manager | HBL Online B.V. | Tilburg | 32-40 uur | HBL Online/Fixami is een zeer snelgroeiende e-commerce organisatie en hét adres voor de verkoop van gereedschap aan professionals en thuisklussers. Met webwinkels en via marketplaces zijn wij actief in Nederland (marktleider met Gereedschapcentrum.nl), België, Frankrijk, Spanje, Italië en Duitsland (Fixami) met het doel om Europa verder te veroveren. Al 5 jaar op rij zijn wij één van de snelst groeiende bedrijven van Zuid-Nederland. Continu zijn we bezig met innovatie en optimalisatie van onze techniek en organisatie, om de zeer sterke groei op de juiste manier te kunnen blijven ondersteunen. Daar horen natuurlijk de juiste mensen bij! Om onze groei waar te kunnen maken, zijn wij ter uitbreiding van ons Development op zoek naar een Pricing Manager. Wat jij gaat doen als Pricing Manager In e-commerce is het aanbieden van een product tegen de juiste prijs op elk gewenst moment van groot belang om maximaal resultaat te behalen. Als pricing manager ben jij zowel op strategisch als operationeel vlak verantwoordelijk voor het bepalen en uitvoeren van het juiste prijsbeleid, het vinden van die sweet spot op het gebied van P*Q die ervoor zorgt dat we optimaal resultaat behalen. Dit doe je uiteraard niet alleen, maar samen met de diverse purchase- en category managers, de business analyst en sales en marketing collega’s en jouw team van pricing analysten dat je gaat opzetten en waar je als meewerkend voorman onderdeel van bent. Door middel van data en concurrentie-analyses ontdek je commerciële kansen en creëer je samen met je winnende prijsstrategieën. Naast het optimaliseren van onze automatische pricing methodiek analyseer je ook specifieke product- en bundelprijzen en kom je met verbeterplannen voor de pricing op onze eigen websites in Europa en de market places waar we onze producten aanbieden. Je voert tests uit en ontdekt op die manier wat onze klanten tot kopen aanzet. Je onderzoekt nieuwe pricing methodieken en systemen en speelt een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling en toepassing van deze technieken en systemen binnen onze organisatie. Jij bent onze ideale kandidaat als: Je beschikt over een WO/master opleiding – en denkniveau in econometrie (of vergelijkbaar) Je hebt 2-5 jaar ervaring in een commerciële data/pricing rol Je bent sterk analytisch en hebt commercieel inzicht, je vindt de patronen in data en kunt ook anderen daar inzicht in geven Je beschikt over een uitstekende helicopterview en kunt goed procesmatig denken Je hebt een innovatief en creatief denkpatroon met het doel tot een oplossing te komen Je bent communicatief sterk en bent bekwaam in de Engelse taal Je bent ‘eager to learn’ met een entrepreneurial mindset Ervaring met Python/R-studio en SQL is een pré Wat wij jou bieden: Bovenal een zeer interessante en uitdagende baan in een hard groeiende, informele en inspirerende internationale werkomgeving Er is bij ons veel ruimte voor jouw visie en inbreng, we vinden het fijn als je meedenkt over nieuwe mogelijkheden; Flexibele werkuren Een marktconform salaris in combinatie met prima secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden waaronder 25 vakantiedagen (mogelijkheid tot bijkopen), bedrijfsfitness, aantrekkelijke personeelskorting & gezellige personeelsfeesten! Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

title: Data Scientist, Payments
