description: About the Role We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our Money Data Science & Product Analytics team, and make significant contributions to our mission to streamline and optimize Uber's payment experience(s). You will shape the direction of Uber's payment experience by analyzing vast quantities of data to gather insights, identify opportunities, and ultimately prioritize product and engineering initiatives. In this role, you will work closely with senior leaders in Product, Data Science, Engineering, and Operations on fast-moving, high-stakes problems. A deep analytical passion and the ability to execute on key business priorities is a must for this role. Who you are: Undergraduate and/or graduate in Math, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or another quantitative field. 3+ years experience as a Data Scientist, Product Analyst, Sr. Data Analyst, or other type of data analysis-focused functions. Excellent SQL skills and experience with either Python or R. Proven ability to wrangle large datasets, explore and utilize raw data feeds. Demonstrated aptitude toward Data Storytelling and Root Cause Analysis using data. Excellent understanding of statistical principles backed by an academic foundation. Bonus if you have: Prior exposure to running and measuring the results of controlled experiments (A/B testing). Ability to build effective visualizations to communicate data to key decision-makers. Ability to learn and adapt to new methodologies for data collection and analysis. Ability to deliver on tight timelines and prioritize tasks while maintaining quality and detail. Ability to work in a self-guided manner. Superb communication and organization skills. Prior experience within the payments industry is strongly desirable. At Uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. We take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 10,000 cities around the world. We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. If you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let's move the world forward, together.

title: Data Engineer
description: Zonder de Data Engineer geen werkbare data-aanpak bij de bank. Een fascinerende functie die iedere dag het uiterste van je vraagt. Solliciteer nu en ervaar het zelf! Wat maakt deze functie aantrekkelijk voor jou? Je verdient een goed salaris op basis van kennis en kunde; Je komt te werken in een datawalhalla. Wat ga je doen? De Data Engineer is dé expert op gebied van data-infrastructuur. Om alle in- en externe databronnen die een bank gebruikt goed samen te brengen in een bruikbare database heb je heel veel kennis nodig van scripting en programmeertalen. De Data Engineer verzamelt data uit meerdere bronnen en integreert zo zoveel mogelijk in één database (een Data Warehouse). Zonder Data Engineering is het analyseren van alle beschikbare data uit een organisatie niet mogelijk. Het werk van een Data Analist of Data Scientist kan pas beginnen als de Engineer klaar is. Banken zijn voor hun kernprocessen afhankelijk van data. Met name in de Risk & Compliance zijn ze bovendien zeer afhankelijk van de integratie van verschillende databronnen. Om die reden zijn banken doorlopend op zoek naar Data Engineers. De Data Engineer is in zijn dagelijkse werk ook betrokken bij datavraagstukken. Denk aan problemen met datakwaliteit of datagebruik. Van een Engineer wordt doorlopend verwacht dat hij meedenkt over problemen en de daarbij behorende oplossingen op datavlak. Daarbij stelt de Engineer zichzelf regelmatig de vraag: wat heeft de eindgebruiker (de klant) hier uiteindelijk aan? De Data Steward en de Business Analist zijn de voornaamste bewakers van deze datakwesties, maar de Engineer denkt hier zeker in mee en heeft een signalerende rol op dit vlak. Waarom kies jij voor deze functie? Je hebt al een aantal jaren ervaring als Data Engineer. Je technische kennis van databases kent geen grenzen. Een uitdaging is welkom. Je zoekt een markt waar data zo rijkelijk vloeit dat de beheersing van deze stroom een serieuze klus is. Het bankwezen bijvoorbeeld. Door de toenemende hoeveelheid transacties wordt de afhankelijkheid van data met de dag groter. En de data-afdelingen worden met de dag belangrijker. Dit trekt zeer veel professionals aan en dit maakt data-afdelingen van banken tot inspirerende werkplekken waar de passie voor het vak door iedereen dag in, dag uit ervaren wordt. Klinkt aanlokkelijk? Reageer dan zeker! Over het algemeen zijn er een aantal terugkerende functie-eisen voor Data Engineers: Je hebt een HBO/WO diploma op ICT-gebied; Je hebt minimaal twee jaar ervaring als Data Engineer; Je hebt verregaande kennis van programmeertalen zoals SQL; Je hebt ruimte ervaring met ETL-tooling. Waarom kies jij voor Carrierecafe? Carrierecafe streeft naar werkgeluk op de lange termijn. We leren de persoon achter jouw CV graag kennen. Onze recruiters hebben jarenlange ervaring in de financiële wereld en daarom weten we waar jij het beste tot je recht komt. Mogelijk is dat bij de opdrachtgever van deze vacature. Misschien zien we een andere loopbaankans voor je. We helpen je om succesvol te worden op je eigen manier. Carrierecafe communiceert transparant naar jou. We zijn overal eerlijk en concreet over. Voor en ná je sollicitatie. Je toekomstige takenpakket, het beoogde salaris dat daarbij hoort en zelfs je kansen op een openstaande functie, we doen nergens geheimzinnig over. Carrierecafe gaat graag een lange reis met je aan. Eerlijkheid duurt het langst! Dus wil jij succesvol en gelukkig worden op de werkvloer? Kies dan voor Carrierecafe! En natuurlijk hebben we ook secundaire voorwaarden! #LI-DS1

title: Dataplatform/-management specialist CDO
description: De functie Dataplatform Specialist heeft twee hoofd-aandachtgebieden. Ten eerste het uitvoeren van de rol van eigenaar en product-owner van het huidige DWH en Referentieserver. Hierbij sta je in nauw contact met zowel de afnemers in de business als het ontwikkel/beheerteam binnen ITC. Je stelt weegt belangen af, prioriteiten en zorgt dat de continuïteit gewaarborgd blijft.  Het andere aandachtsgebied betreft het verder ontwikkelingen van het dataplatform. Vanuit de CDO-organisatie zorg je voor een goede alignment tussen de (toekomstige) behoefte vanuit de business en het dataplatform. Je geeft mede richting en vorm aan de ontwikkeling van het dataplatform en zorgt voor een goede business-implementatie en gebruik. Daarbij werk je samen met je CDO-office collega’s, Architectuur, IT en de business.  Op termijn wordt de Dataplatform Specialist mogelijk ook verantwoordelijk voor het eigenaar- en productownerschap van één of meerdere componenten van het dataplatform en vanuit daar verantwoordelijk voor verdere doorontwikkeling en alignement tussen behoefte en het dataplatform.  Verantwoordelijkheden / werkzaamheden Vanuit eigenaar- en productownerschap van DWH (BDV en FDWH 1.0) en de referentieserver 1.0 prioriteren onderhoudswerkzaamheden en accorderen van gevraagde changes. Borgen dat het DWH eisen van wetgeving, compliance en audit voldoet. Vanuit eigenaarschap betrokken bij migratie van DWH naar nieuwe componenten van het dataplatform dan wel het onderbrengen van DWH in dat dataplatform. Blijvend zorgen van goede doorvertaling van (veranderende) databehoeften naar (nieuwe) vereisten aan dataplatform (met name ten aanzien van data management en datagebruik). Borgen van een goede business implementatie en gebruik van (componenten van) het dataplatform. Samen met CDO-collega’s verbinden dataplatform met databeleid (o.a. op het gebied van mate van datamanagement-eisen) Mogelijk eigenaar- en productownerschap van één of meerdere nieuwe dataplatform-componenten. Adviseren ten aanzien dataplatform componenten (o.a. op het gebied van datamanagement). Namens de CDO-organisatie deelnemen aan (strategische) programma’s/projecten op het gebied van dataplatform. Over de afdeling  De CDO-office is een van de onderdelen binnen Waardestroom, Data en Informatiemanagement (WDI). CDO-Office is een team van 8 dataprofessionals dat dagelijks samen met de CDO werkt aan het inrichten, verbeteren en verder professionaliseren van de datamanagementfunctie binnen de Volksbank.  Binnen de Volksbank zijn veel verantwoordelijkheden ten aanzien van data decentraal belegd. De rol van de CDO-office is met name om zorg te dragen voor de juiste richting, kaders, organisatie, processen en ondersteuning, zodat aan die verantwoordelijkheden invulling gegeven kan worden en om te borgen dat de Volksbank-breed op het gebied van data goed wordt samengewerkt. Dit alles om data zo goed mogelijk te managen en om waarde met data te kunnen creëren.  Wij vragen Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring met data van financiële instellingen, bijvoorbeeld in de rol van business analist of Datawarehouse-specialist; WO/HBO werk- en denkniveau (op bedrijfsinformatica of bedrijfskundig gebied); Kennis van datamanagement, datagovernance en het interpreteren van bijbehorend beleid; Begrip van bedrijfsprocessen en waardeketens en informatiehuishouding van de Volksbank; Hoewel met name aan de business-kant wordt geopereerd is kennis van ‘IT-kant van data’ en dataplatformen een pre. Werken bij de Volksbank & het coronavirus In deze bijzondere periode volgen wij de richtlijnen van het RIVM. Als jouw werk het toestaat, dan werk je vanuit huis. Als je bij ons start in je nieuwe baan, krijg je uiteraard hulp van je collega’s om dit zo makkelijk mogelijk te maken. Bij de Volksbank zijn er voldoende faciliteiten om op afstand goed met elkaar samen te werken. Om jouw thuiswerkplek goed in te richten, krijg je een budget van 600 euro. Ook ontvang je een maandelijkse thuiswerkvergoeding van 40 euro om jouw extra kosten te dekken. En het gaat natuurlijk verder dan jouw fysieke werkplek. Je leidinggevende blijft met jou in gesprek over een gezonde werkomgeving.  Solliciteren? Reageer op deze vacature vie de "sollicitatie button". Laat je motivatie en cv achter en we nemen zo snel mogelijk contact met je op. Voor vragen over het sollicitatieproces kun je contact opnemen met Vera Reidinga, Corporate Recruiter, vera.reidinga@devolksbank.nl. Voor meer informatie over de functie kun je contact opnemen met Peter Roos, 06 12 467 523.

title: Senior Analist NGS laboratorium
description: Wil je met de allernieuwste DNA-sequencing technologie werken en daarmee een bijdrage leveren aan de verbetering van de behandeling van kankerpatiënten? Hartwig Medical Foundation genereert DNA-data van patiënten met uitgezaaide kanker en integreert deze met klinische- en behandelgegevens voor een patiëntrapport en opslag in een landelijke databank. Dit gebeurt met behulp van Whole Genome Sequencing (WGS) technologie en bioinformatische analyse van de tumor specifieke DNA-kenmerken van de patiënt. Daarnaast ondersteunen we via onze sequencing services DNA- en RNA-onderzoek, dat afhankelijk is van een ervaren high tech sequencing laboratorium. Ons laboratorium is uitgerust met specifieke apparatuur zoals QiaSymphony, Biomek4000, Biomek i7, NovaSeq, NextSeq en iSeq. Wij zoeken een proactief en gestructureerd werkende Senior Analist voor ons Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) laboratorium, die naast het uitvoeren van analyses zich ook richt op klantcontact en serviceverlening. De Senior Analist zet zich in voor zowel Hartwig Medical OncoAct als Hartwig Sequencing Services. Je activiteiten bestaan onder andere uit: Ontvangst en registratie van materialen; Hands on laboratorium taken zoals het opwerken en sequencen van materialen inclusief het invoeren van gegevens in LIMS; Apparatuur- en voorraadbeheer; Programmering van de liquid handeling robots; Coördinatie van Hartwig Sequencing Services: onderhouden en realiseren van klantcontact, opstellen van contracten, up-to-date houden van social media en de website en bewaken van facturatie; Zorg dragen voor hygiëne en veiligheid op het laboratorium. Jij brengt het volgende mee: BSc. in Life Sciences of vergelijkbaar; Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring met NGS; Ervaring in een diagnostische omgeving en het werken binnen een kwaliteitssysteem (ISO17025) is een pré; Aantoonbare affiniteit met robotica, je bent in staat om de robots te kunnen programmeren; Het intrigeert je om in een high tech sequencing laboratorium te werken waar zoveel mogelijk is geautomatiseerd; Ervaring met klantcontact, zowel opstarten als onderhouden; Een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal; Affiniteit met kankeronderzoek; Je bent gevaccineerd tegen Hepatitis B of bent bereid tot vaccinatie; Naast het feit dat je een echte team player bent, pak je zaken zelfstandig op en bewaak je de afgesproken deadlines. Daarnaast beschik jij over de volgende competenties: Flexibel en stressbestendig; Sociaal en tevens communicatief sterk; Proactief en gedreven; Enthousiast; Verantwoordelijk. Ons aanbod Een leuke afwisselende fulltimebaan in een enthousiast team. Een aanstelling voor in eerste instantie een jaar, met kans op verlenging. Je salaris bepalen we op basis van je (werk)ervaring en achtergrond. Leuke collega’s, kantoorlunches, regelmatig borrelen en gezelligheid. Je bent onderdeel van het proces voor het verbeteren van de behandeling voor kankerpatiënten. Je faciliteert hoogstaand onderzoek en een whole genome DNA-test die wereldwijd voorloper is. Benefits: Money for vacation Company pension Additional holidays Contract length: 12 months Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Bepaalde tijd Werkschema: ma-vr Voorzorgsmaatregelen tegen het coronavirus: Op afstand solliciteren Persoonlijke beschermingsmiddelen worden uitgedeeld/zijn verplicht Er gelden richtlijnen voor social distancing Virtuele vergaderingen Er zijn ontsmettings-, desinfecteer- of schoonmaakprocedures van kracht

title: Innovation Analyst Internship
description: Job description - Innovation Analyst Internship  The rapid growth of Dealroom.co requires a keen and curious Innovation Analyst Intern who is genuinely interested in innovation, technology trends or the startup & scaleup environment. You are eager to provide meaningful insights and content in support of our community, and able to recognise a good story when you see one. As part of the Intelligence Unit your primary objective is to derive original, creative and solid insights from our database, containing intelligence about startups, innovation and venture capital investments. You are very comfortable playing with numbers and data to discover interesting trends and angles in our user-friendly data platform and turn them into a compelling narrative for our readers, create influential reports, data charts and eye-catching taglines. You will also be working directly with our clients to understand their needs into mutual success. The mission of the Intelligence Unit is to reveal insights about solutions, surface new opportunities for innovation and support the delivery of projects around innovation solutions. An internship in our office is a learning experience which will provide you with a 360-degree view on how technology is shaping our future. If you are keen, focused, and creative, with a good understanding of technology and a proactive mindset, please read further!  About Dealroom Dealroom is Europe’s leading provider of startup data & insights. Founded in Amsterdam in 2013, our mission is to support entrepreneurship and innovation, by providing the most trusted intelligence and insights on the journeys of companies. We enable Venture Capital firms, corporates, advisory firms, and governments to stay at the forefront of innovation, discover the world’s most promising organisations, and identify strategic opportunities.  Our core products: 1. The Dealroom SaaS platform offers an intuitive interface to identify and track promising startups and analyse broader industry/business model trends. 2. The Dealroom API, enables our clients to integrate Dealroom’s investment-grade data straight into their own applications and processes. 3. Custom research projects combine Dealroom data with expert insights, to create market-leading industry deep-dives and trend analysis. 4. Dealroom Ecosystem Solutions, provide open-access community startup data platforms to support local governments, founders, and investors. Our curated and crowdsourced data and insights foster industry connections and showcase domestic tech sector strength on the global stage. Examples include Berlin, The Netherlands, and the United Kingdom.   Our clients include world-leading firms such as Mckinsey, BCG, Deloitte, Google, Amazon, Microsoft, Sony, Sequoia, Insight VP, Balderton Capital, EQT, and many others, which all rely on Dealroom Data in their strategic decision-making.  Team We operate from the heart of Amsterdam. Our passion for startups, scale-ups and innovation lives in our work, informing reliable intelligence and new insights for our users. Our team is ambitious, diligent, and proactive, but with a strong sense of fun, as seen at weekly team drinks! We continuously strive to live our 6 company values: Empathy, Courage, Positivity, Curiosity, Focus Outward, and be Hungry While we’re currently obviously working entirely remotely, we do have a spacious office available when and if it suits you.   Your tasks and responsibilities As an Innovation Analyst Intern you will Analyse our database and external sources to generate noteworthy insights and trends Take responsibility for unique and influential content for reports, posts or presentations Identify and drive process improvements, including the creation of standard and ad-hoc reports Control the quality and curate the content of Dealroom.co database Understand the needs of the hiring organization or client in order to target research to their benefit Work closely with Partnerships and Customer Success Teams to engage with customers in delivering influential content  Who you are / Your background Currently enrolled in last year of undergraduate or graduate level studies with a declared major in Finance or similar field of study. Interest in and passion for technology, startups and venture capital markets Proficiency with Google Suite & Microsoft Office, with a strong emphasis in Sheets, Slides, Excel and PowerPoint Advanced speaking and report-writing skills for effective communication Organised, logical and number-oriented person Strong analytical and problem solving skills Attention to details and a commitment to accuracy Fluent command of English; any other European language is a great advantage  What we can offer you Internship fee Freedom and responsibility to execute on your own ideas Positive, empathic, and outward-focused colleagues, and customers working at the forefront of innovation and technology Perks designed to set you up for success in a new reality: Flexible working hours Home-office setup (screen, etc) Travel reimbursement Additionally: Take your birthday off Learning & development budget More to come!

title: Technical Warranty Analyst EMEA
description: The Role The ‘EMEA Returns Technical Warranty Analyst’ will be responsible for assisting in determining root cause failure of all Tesla return parts. Other responsibilities include diligently adding this information and evidence into Tesla’s Root Cause Database, developing relationships with other functional departments to ensure the parts or information is transferred to the appropriate department. Preferred candidates will have knowledge of NDT procedures but be acutely aware of results that can be gleaned from performing pragmatic destructive test procedures. Planning, accuracy, intelligence, stamina and deduction, are qualities that are necessary for this role. Responsibilities Perform destructive and non-destructive Root Cause Analysis on Tesla products based upon guidance from Technicians and SOP’s. Perform database transactions to manage the tracking, receiving, storing and moving of parts. Provide simultaneous support and route parts back to Supplier, Quality, Engineering, or Remanufacturing based on guidance and instructions. Physically moving failed parts across engineering departments and failure analysis labs (external and internal) to assure quick root cause investigations. Dispositioning returned parts based on guidance from the engineering group. Working closely with the team to assure data integrity, accuracy and efficiency in handling of returned parts. Utilizing multiple databases to flag individual components for review, and tracking transaction. Assure cleanliness, organization and safety of the MRB receiving and storing area, making this process world class and on par with Tesla’s standards. Assist in implementation and maintenance of 5S and MRB best practices. Perform simple test procedures as indicated by a supplied SOP. Navigate through Tesla’s database systems such as WarpDrive. Reviews and Analyzes warranty and company pay material returns at central returns location. Provides initial determination if part is defective along with potential causes. Develops test plans to analyse return parts and identify cause(s). Issues Work Order Requests from external and internal parties. Provides timely updates and status to Supplier, Quality and Management. Writes reports including internal Problem Solving and Supplier requested documents. Works with Product Engineer, Quality Engineer, and Supplier to inform on recurrence and rate of occurrence. Works with Technical Leads and Technicians to implement test procedures. Works with Quality and or Purchasing to develop appropriate countermeasures including Immediate Corrective Action and Permanent Corrective Action. Monitors effectiveness of countermeasures. Provides recommendations to reduce warranty costs. Supports Warranty Review meetings with suppliers. Makes presentations to suppliers and internal departments as required. Requirements Bachelors’ degree or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability. Working knowledge of Microsoft Outlook, Word, and Excel. Strong communication skills and ability to build strong partnerships across various organizations within Tesla. Previous Failure Analysis/Root Cause Analysis/8D problem solving experience is a plus. Ability to work independently and keep on task in an extremely fast-paced environment without direct supervision. Must be detail orientated, reliable, have good initiative, determination, and quality focused. Ability to perform repetitive duties whilst standing. Job Type: Full-time Experience: mathematics and algebra: 2 years (Required) Work Remotely: No COVID-19 Precaution(s): Remote interview process

title: BI Specialist
description: The job description of BI Specialist The BI specialist is a new role within the business unit and he or she will report to the director Finance within the Finance and IT department. The Finance and IT department include plant controlling (4 plants), sales controlling and is responsible for the best use of our information systems. The finance and IT team currently consists of 9 people. The BI specialist is using analytical skills for analyzing (financial) data. You are not only able to analyze and interpret the data in the right way, but you also know how to make the connection with commerce, to use this data to create opportunities. As a data analyst you have strong communication skills and you know how to translate the "technical" language into concrete feedback and ideas for your colleagues. Top 100 food company Every day 100 million consumers worldwide eat a meal with a little bit of Vion. This quantity comes with a big responsibility. At Vion we work passionately every day on the global food challenge: feeding 9 billion people in 2050. How can you contribute to this? The main responsibilities of your role can be described as follows: As a result of the Vion strategy 2020-2024 ‘towards a sustainable future’ a new business unit Retail has been established during the end of 2019. This business unit is responsible for our prepacked and processed meat activities including our newly started business in Leeuwarden for meat alternatives. Support the development of business intelligence processes within the business unit retail; Be the linking pin to the central data analytics competence center and participate in the BI implementation project; Align and prioritize with key account management team on management information requirements and translate insights into a sales dashboards by using internal and external data sources; Align and prioritize with our operations team on management information requirements and translate insights into a relevant KPI dashboards; Assist in improving and standardizing management information, reporting and KPI’s based on best practices identified; Perform data-analysis to improve management information and business and sales controlling; Participate in projects to optimize business intelligence processes and the use of our financial and ERP systems; Prepare ad-hoc analyses and decision support to the management team, financial and key account management.  What do we expect from you? We are looking for a responsible and energetic young professional, ambitious, willing to invest in his or her own development in a (international) environment, working in our offices in Boxtel and Groenlo. Our candidate has: Master degree in business information management, business information technology, information management or other relevant education; 2 - 4 years of relevant working experience in a similar position; Knowledge of business intelligence processes, related tools (PowerBI) and visualization of data through this tooling; A self-starter mentality for preparation of management reporting; Interest in data analysis and a drive to take a leading role to translate data into understandable analysis by using data analyses tools; Good working knowledge of PowerBI, MS Office (expert user of Excel), ERP systems and databases and/or the willingness to develop expert skills; Fluent in Dutch and English (both orally and in writing), while German is a big plus; No 9 to 5 mentality. What can you expect from us? In our company you will have an attractive, versatile and challenging position within a leading international food company, with around 12.000 employees worldwide, innovative market concepts and clear core values. We offer good working conditions and an inspiring environment to work in an enthusiastic team. Are you interested? In case you think you are the right candidate to become our new colleague, or would you like to have more information about this position? Share your talents with us by sending your application letter and resume before March 15th via the ‘apply’ button below. For information ask Christel van Oers via phone number +316 187 499 79. For this position Vion is looking for direct contacts with potential candidates; we appreciate if companies do not offer their services in this.

title: Product Owner
description: Talespin is building the platform to transform talent development and skill alignment for the future of work. Our spatial computing products deliver a new standard for learning and workforce data, empowering organizations, and individuals to make better talent and career decisions. We're looking for an experienced Product Owner for our authorizing tools team to help drive our mission to transform the way humans learn, work, and collaborate. We are looking for a highly motivated, agile, and experienced Product Owner. You will report directly to the Product Manager, and will be responsible to contribute to the program vision, continuously improve product quality and value, while managing those strategic goals into actionable tasks. You will work with stakeholders across the organization to map and manage requirements and priorities in the backlog for cross-functional teams (both internal and external). The Product Owner will be responsible to manage deliverables through each stage of the development process from design and prototype through deployment and maintenance. The ideal candidate will have systems, design and coding experience, to compliment their exceptional organizational and leadership skills. If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you! In This Role You Will: Create stories, epics, and themes and ensure work priorities are aligned with product strategies to deliver maximum user value. Take personal accountability for ensuring that team actions and backlog are consistently and fully aligned to the technical needs, strategic needs, and objectives of the business and/or client(s). Document product technical requirements for the development and IT organization in line with market problems communicated by the product leadership, and collaborate with the development team to ensure backlog (tickets and Epics) contain the necessary detail to ensure efficient prioritization, coding, testing, and client validation. Regularly prioritize, monitor, and track progress of the team backlog and commitments against targets, communicating this with the team to manage expectations and suggest additional support when needed. Present complex information and ideas through open, transparent communication to engender trust and ensure mutual understanding. Gather additional insight directly from the client and other external sources of expert information to offer unique and current perspectives on the overall product vision and backlog. Be an expert at identifying and acting against complex and distant potential road blockers, holding team members accountable for identifying and addressing individual road blockers to personal progress. Consistently demonstrate excellent technical knowledge and proficiency, sharing this with others in their team to improve performance. Consistently demonstrates effective time management across challenging and overlapping projects, supporting others in the team with managing their schedule. Lead Backlog Grooming and Sprint Review sessions, while making sure to attend all other sprint events as an active participant. Bring commercial expertise, sound business judgment, and draws on external sources to prioritize and help reshape the product vision and road map. Establish and keep to budgets and resources available that align with other departments.  What We Look For in a Candidate: Bachelor's (BA or BS) in business, computer science, or related field Minimum of five years' previous experience as a Product Owner, Scrum Master, Business Analyst, or in a related field. Prior experience working in a technology start-up environment In-depth understanding of Agile methodologies, technical understanding of products, and up-to-date on industry standards and best practices Experience with Jira and Confluence High sense of urgency and ability to work well in and navigate a matrix environment. Effectively interface with development, business, analytics, operations, systems, and marketing personnel. Excellent leadership and decision-making skills. Advanced oral and strong written communication skills. Advanced product management, project management, and organizational skills. All applicants must have EU citizenship, or an EU work permit.

title: Contract and Billing Administrator
description: Job summary As our part of our Contract Management department, the Contract & Billing Administrator is responsible for the review and execution of sales contract; ensuring the contracts submitted align with our financial guidelines and contract management processes. The Contract Administrator is also responsible for creating debtors and submitting the product lines into the ERP system, invoicing, and supporting the order to cash processes in an accurate, complete and timely manner. The full-time position reports to the Billing & Accounts Receivable Manager and will be based in The Netherlands at our Utrecht office. DTN is looking for We are a global organization looking for an enthusiastic, experienced and skilled, self-starter who can take ownership of their area of responsibility. Our ideal candidate is an organized, pro-active and service-minded individual who possesses an impeccable attention to detail. Furthermore, our candidate is analytical, maintains a strong grasp of the O2C and accounting processes; identifies company risks; process inefficiencies and drives the improvement process. Duties and responsibilities Daily review and processing of sales contracts in line with set timeframes, guidelines and procedures Collaborate with other departments to ensure contract completeness prior to processing within the system Input data in the billing and accounting system to ensure accuracy of final invoice Ensure timely, complete and accurate billing based on existing and new controls for various DTN business units in our billing system Distribute customer invoices through various channels (e-mail, third party, portal, etc.) Resolve billing issues and address customer invoice queries Own and maintain debtor master data, including set up of new debtors Maintain data and reconcile subscription and sales orders in different systems Support month end closing procedures, including assisting accounting in revenue recognition process for accrued and unbilled transactions Develop and maintain strong business relationships; ability to communicate on all business levels to various stakeholders Participate in various ad-hoc projects to improve order-to-cash process Requirements and qualifications Basic degree in Finance, Accounting or Business Administration and a minimum of 4-6 years proven experience as a Billing / Contract Analyst or similar finance role Good knowledge of the O2C, as well electronic billing systems and procedures Experience within a Financial Shared Service Centre is preferred Adherence to laws and best practices relating to customers and data VAT knowledge is preferred Well organized with the ability to achieve deadlines in a fast-paced, diverse, changing environment Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written in English. Additional languages (German and/or French and/or Spanish) are preferred Benefits: Work from home opportunities Christmas money Money for vacation Company pension Education reimbursement Expected Start Date: 01/04/2021 Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Permanent COVID-19 considerations: To keep our workplace safe, we have taken proper safety measures for all our employees including propoer seating arrrangement and face masks. Experience: Contract or Billing or Invoicing: 4 years (Required) Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19 COVID-19 Precaution(s): Remote interview process Social distancing guidelines in place Virtual meetings Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description: Senior Marketing Data Analyst Do you have 4+ years of experience as a data analyst after you finished your Bachelor's degree? Are you a master in SQL, (PostgreSQL and Big Query) combined with experience with programming in Python or R? Would you like to work for a ambitions growth organisation as CarNext.com in an exciting and constantly changing (online) market? If you answered yes to the above questions, please apply for this challenging position as our Senior Marketing Data Analyst in our international scale-up environment!  This is CarNext.com CarNext.com is a scale-up with a start-up mentality. We're bold and have a passion to change the status quo. We're building a transparent digital marketplace that customers can trust. And it's the same at CarNext.com. We're proud of our open culture, collaborative ethos, vibrant environment and can-do approach. As we grow our business, we're keen to hear from people who understand what we're about and can help us achieve our mission.  Help us build the future of mobility! As the Senior Marketing Data Analyst, you will make a crucial contribution to the insight and utilization of data within the company. Whilst being a valuable member of the Marketing Department, you will work with all parts of the company to help them give the right business decision. It's important to us that our new Senior Data Analyst is someone who works with precision, is decisive, has a great set of analytical skills and loves driving business decisions coming from data.  In this role you will be: Identifying trends Analyzing patterns in measurement data, expanding validation options; Fixing the data issues and communications around it Creating new metrics after doing all the necessary checks Testing hypothesis Participate in project teams for custom measurements and data flows; Developing the data collection of new meters; Support in the daily activities of the Data team; Organizing imports and exports of data (APIs); Contributes actively to securing and transferring knowledge in the organization; Building knowledge meters and protocols;  Must haves for this role: Bachelor's degree (undergraduate program completed), preferably in Engineering, Business, Marketing or other relevant fields, a Master's degree is a nice to have 4+ years of experience as data analyst, which required good stakeholder management and communication skills Stakeholder Management and good communication skills Statistical knowledge and data modelling is required Really analytical mindset and eye for business needs Mastered in Excel Mastered in SQL, (PostgreSQL and Big Query) Have experience with Programming Languages – Python (or R) Statistical knowledge and good understanding of mathematical theorems English (fluent, verbally and written), and second language is a nice to have  Skills that you need in order to succeed in this position: Ambition and self-motivation Energetic, flexible and always looing to learn new things; An amazing team player and willing to go above and beyond in delivering great work; Have a proactive and flexible mind set, with an attitude to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, start-up like environment.  The team You will work in a small team in which you will get every opportunity to further develop yourself.  Grow with us CarNext.com provides ample opportunities for personal and professional growth. If you feel this is a great match with your skills, Go ahead, apply and send us your CV

title: Sr. Platform Analyst - Services - B2B Serv Cloud
description: Job Title Sr. Platform Analyst - Services - B2B Serv Cloud Job Description In this role, you have the opportunity to Support Intake business requirements and deliver Solution Design together with BPO, Solution Architects, Platform Solution Managers, Project Manager and other key stakeholders. Work closely with Platform Solution Managers, Tribe leads in supporting Solution/Release planning and other Agile Phases. Support Product Owner, Solution Architect in Grooming, Solution design including NFRs, Estimation, Validation and help drive feature driven development with scrum teams. Ensuring high quality backlog boosting the performance of scrum teams Own, Optimize E2E Solution Development Process and support fellow DevOps engineers to realize the solution Support business in demonstrating the capabilities, training, deployments, onboarding business/markets & change management Accountable that the solutions design/ technology meets the functional and non-functional requirements with focus on Realisability, Reliability, Security and performance. Accountable that solution design meets platform architecture principles & guidelines. Provide feedback on continuous improvement to architecture community Responsible for Software Quality, Compliance & Regulatory aspects of the solution. Involve in Peer review, demo and other scrum ceremonies Responsible to validate test strategy and plan, test cases, automation, regression and test execution. Raise impediments on time to leads and support resolution Identify Kaizen opportunities at work and improve process and delivery Endorses the content of the release (including NFRs) prior to release and manages interdependency with other programs. Actively work to reduce technical debt and refactor the application for performance Identify E2E Business Processes together with BPO / BPE that are critical and establish monitoring via OCC Work closely with DevOps team in supporting key Domain and Technical inputs for Incidents, Change Requests, Service Requests and other regular operations activities. Support Operations and business with SME Expertise during crisis management for business continuity across global time zones. Support Platform Landscape upgrades, improvements to stay aligned with OEM guidelines Competence Development of New entrants (Employees and Partners) Ensures solution guidelines are up to date in Knowledge repository/Wiki Stay current with Market knowledge on Platform Technology Curve You are responsible for Analysing processes and making proposals regarding process re-engineering and use of IT tools & architecture. Responsible for one complete application area and related processes. Recognized as a SME in related technologies and domains, has clear understanding of future technology trends Making sure all aspects of design, use of existing IT packages, documentation and SLA support are in compliance. Providing direction to scrum teams in designing E2E solutions. Drive improvements across standards, guidelines & process. Working with Devops teams for all operational activities including Incidents, MEC, YEC and service Catalogues. Building a worldwide external network and makes this knowledge applicable for the business, now and in the future. Representing Philips externally on related issues, and spearheads international platforms. Investigating the feasibility of new solutions, choice of technology and platforms. You are a part of You will join the Services platform within the IT Group where you will contribute to the business and focusing on Transforming while Performing through DecSecOps ways of working and providing Best in Class Services to our end customers.  To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree OG Certification Level 2/3 Lean Advance Certificate / Green Belt Domain or related IT experience for > 15 years Certified in one or more functional domain and related business processes Expert on a complete application area and related IT solutions. Knowledge of the newest IT technology. Strong influence from architecture of business process, IT solutions and tool selection. Understands business trends and the direction technology must take to support the business. Able to identify the strategic IT implications and opportunities resulting from major corporate strategies and change initiatives. SAP Tax experience of at-least 1-2 years with strong functional knowledge At-least two full end to end implementation experience mandatory Expertise in all domains in SAP FICO – New GL including Document Splitting, Asset Accounting, Accounts Receivable and Payable, Automatic Payment processing, Payment method workbench, Period End Closing, Electronic Bank Statement processing, Lockbox processing, Check processing, Rebate and Accrual processing, Revenue Recognition, Results Analysis, General controlling, basic knowledge in Project system, General Controlling for CO related settings; Cost Element and Cost Center Accounting – Planning, Budgeting, Assessment, Distribution etc.; Internal Order Accounting – Planning, Budgeting, Settlement etc.; Product Costing – Planning, Cost Object Controlling, Actual Costing, Material Ledger; CO-PA – Profitability Segments and Characteristics, Planning, Flow of Actual Values, Reports Preferred experience in the FSCM modules - Credit Management – Master Data, Credit Limit Request, Credit Limit Check, DCD, Exposure updates, Handling standing enhancements; Collections Management – Master Data and Organizational Structure, Strategies, Worklist generation and handling, Ways of establishing contacts with customers; Dispute Management – Status and Profile Management, Case type definitions, Workflows; Biller Direct; Integration between AR and FSCM modules; Experience in translating high level solutions into detailed technical design. In return, we offer you An ambitious, innovative environment with excellent opportunities for you to explore. Our benefits are very driven and crafted around your preferences: A competitive salary. A variable bonus based on both Philips' results and personal performance. A validated company pension scheme and an attractive portfolio of benefits The opportunity to buy Philips shares and products at a discount. Why should you join Philips? Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 2.5 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video. To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there,you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions. #LI-EU Contact If you forgot your password, you can click the Forgot Password button on the Sign In screen to reset it.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description: Within our Group Financial Service Centre we are building our future Digital Finance world. Centre of this new landscape will be the Finance and Risk Data Platform called Alfred. Currently we are full speed ahead into the implementation phase of this multi-faceted programme. As such we are looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join our Alfred DevOps team. This Job offers a maximum monthly salary of Eur 6500 based on 36h. Your responsibilities As Senior Business Analyst in the Alfred DevOps team you will be mainly responsible for: The gathering and analysis of Business requirements for Alfred from relevant users and stakeholders Translating these high level Business requirements in detailed requirements for Alfred where needed and aligning and agreeing with stakeholders on these requirements Define Functional Designs for the Alfred Developers based on the detailed requirements Assessing and updating the Logical Datamodel where needed Aligning with both Functional and Technical leads of Alfred as well as the rest of the DevOps team Your colleagues The Alfred DevOps team is a new team (15 FTEs) and is part of CFO/Group Finance & Reporting/Service Centre Finance/Liability Accounting. The team is responsible for developing and functionally maintaining the risk- and finance data platform (Alfred application). This Platform is used to gather data for internal and external reporting, for both the Dutch business units as well as the International business units. The most important activities for the coming period relate to IFRS17 programme deliverables but is rapidly expanding to include a wider roadmap. The Alfred DevOps team adopted the Agile way of working, and works closely with the IT colleagues that are actually part of the same DevOps team(s). The Agile transition is part of a larger initiative to instil a culture of continuous improvement, customer focus and operational excellence within the Finance organization. Who you are Minimum 8-10 years of work experience in a relevant work area You excel in analytical and problem solving skills WO work and thinking level Accounting or actuarial background is required, knowledge of insurance is key Knowledge of IFRS 17 and/or Solvency II is preferred Experience with data analysis, data flow, functional designs, data modelling and data architecture Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills You are proactive, curious and capable to independently take charge of your responsibilities You have excellent communication skills; fluent in written and spoken English Continue developing It is important to us that you continue to develop yourself. We give you the space and the confidence to grow in your career as well as a person. We help you with: Plenty of training and learning opportunities in our Learning & Development Centre A large (international) network of colleagues who are keen to share their knowledge with you The autonomy to set out your own development path About NN We help people care for what matters most to them. The world in which we live may change, but what really matters to people remains the same. Family, friends, love, health, home and of course work. You help to make our services more personal and relevant. As an organization we can really make a difference with all our brands: Nationale-Nederlanden, NN Investment Partners, ABN AMRO Verzekeringen, Movir, AZL, BeFrank, Zicht and OHRA. Employee benefits You are more than a colleague and we understand that very well at NN. You have different roles in life and that involves choices. We give you the opportunity to select the employee benefits that are important to you and that match your personal situation. This includes buying additional leave, flexible working hours. Your holiday allowance and 13th month are paid with your salary monthly, so there is no need to wait. Because of coronavirus, all NN colleagues are currently working from home fully digitally. It is currently not yet clear when we can return to the office. The official location for this job is The Hague. Will you be our new colleague? If you are enthusiastic about this vacancy and think that you would be a good fit for the team at NN, we would like to invite you to apply. We are very keen to find out who you are, what motivates you and what you can contribute to this role at NN. Apply now If you have any questions about the vacancy give us a call. You can reach out to Camiel de Maat via +31 6 83636873. Questions about the process? Reach out to Marijke Tamsiran via +31(0) 6 21369558.

title: Senior Business Analist Financial Operations
description: Hoe maak jij onze klanten blij? Bol.com verandert retail om het dagelijks leven van 11,5 miljoen Nederlandse en Belgische klanten makkelijker te maken. Uitdagend, want ons online retail tech platform groeit snel. Net als het aantal klantorders dat door de systemen stroomt. In deze rol bedenk en implementeer je fintech innovaties die financiële processen voor klanten en partners makkelijker en prettiger maken. Klinkt simpel? Dat is het niet, want iedere innovatie dient slim en oneindig schaalbaar te zijn. Jij denkt dus vandaag na over de gebruikersprocessen van overmorgen. Innovaties waar klanten en partners blij van worden! COVID-19 en het sollicitatieproces Lees meer info over COVID-19 en ons sollicitatieproces Wat je doet als Senior Business Analist Financial Operations In deze rol ben je de vormgever en realisator van onze financiële transactieverwerking, facturatie- en betaalstroom. Samen met collega Business Analisten, Product Owners en vier dedicated IT teams breng je impactvolle fintech innovaties naar de finish. Bovendien bewaak en onderhoud je processen waarmee we alleen dit jaar al zo’n 80 miljoen (!) transacties verwerken. Een keten waar letterlijk miljarden euro’s doorheen stromen, zodat zelfs minieme haperingen grote financiële consequenties kunnen hebben. Uiteraard houd je als Senior Business Analist Financial Operations nadrukkelijk rekening met mogelijke uitzonderingen op standaard processen, bijvoorbeeld door daar op voorhand passende oplossingen voor te bedenken. Ook faciliteer je 100% zicht op de omzet- en geldstromen en borg je de foutloze koppeling van al die transacties met onze boekhouding. Waarom jij het verschil kunt maken Omdat je een ervaren Business Analist bent die graag vooroploopt in de fintech revolutie en gedegen kennis van financiële processen hebt. Je weet wat er nodig is om morgen succes te boeken en kunt IT-teams aan boord krijgen én houden. Daar slaag je in door je actuele tech expertise, overtuigingskracht en aanstekelijk enthousiasme. People-skills zijn onmisbaar, want IT-teams rapporteren niet aan je. Jij levert de ideeën die zij omzetten in technische oplossingen. Verder stuur je op win-win partnerships met de stakeholders die nodig zijn om te kunnen excelleren op fintech gebied. 3 redenen waarom dit (n)iets voor jou is Wel, als je jouw analytische skills 5+ jaar hebt ingezet binnen innovatieve omgevingen, bijvoorbeeld als Business Analist en/of Product Owner Wel, als je de financiële systemen van de toekomst wilt bedenken in een continu veranderende, hightech en high volume omgeving Wel, als je complexe projecten effectief kunt aansturen en ervaring hebt met financieel operationele processen Niet, als je graag op een eiland werkt en inzichten alleen met jezelf wilt delen Niet, als IT developers je niet begrijpen; je user stories en requirements komen retour met zes A4’tjes vol vraagtekens Niet, als je vanuit je gevoel voor oplossingen kiest; data is ook maar data Hier kom je terecht Bij hét online retail tech platform van Nederland en België. Een platform waar 11,5 miljoen Nederlandse en Belgische klanten kiezen uit meer dan 25 miljoen artikelen. En een platform dat zo’n 35.000 zakelijke partners helpt succesvol te ondernemen. Maar vooral een platform dat nooit ‘af’ is, want bol.com verandert retail al sinds 1999. En dat blijven we doen. Als het beter kan, maken we het beter! Samen met klanten, partners en zo’n 2.100 collega’s. En ja, je werkt bij een marktleider, maar het voelt als een scale-up. Zelforganisatie is de regel en de lijnen zijn zo kort dat je ze vaak niet eens ziet; hoe minder bureaucratie, hoe sneller we innoveren. Je bent onderdeel van de afdeling Fintech die bestaat uit vijf multidisciplinaire en autonome teams, namelijk Payments, Fraud & Risk, Invoicing & Collection en Data. Deze teams, intern meestal producten genoemd, worden niet aangestuurd door een manager, maar aangejaagd door een gedeelde ambitie; de high tech standaard in fintech zetten. De kern het werk zal binnen team Invoicing plaatsvinden, waarbij je nauw samenwerkt met de Productowner en de software engineers. Wat je krijgt Wat je krijgt Wat je nog meer krijgt Een blauwe landing Nieuwe collega's krijgen bij bol.com een warm welkom, zodat jij je zo goed en snel mogelijk thuis voelt bij ons. Tijdens jouw introductieprogramma bol.com & ik, nemen we je helemaal mee in de bol.com wereld! Geld enzo.... Werken bij bol.com is uitdagend en daar zetten we uiteraard iets tegenover. Naast salaris, ontvang je ook een jaarlijkse prestatiegerichte bonus, vakantiegeld, 29 vakantiedagen, woon-en werkverkeer regelingen, aanvullende premievrije verzekeringen en meer. Jouw sollicitatieprocedure Je solliciteert We bekijken je sollicitatie zorgvuldig en binnen 2 weken weet je of we je uitnodigen voor een gesprek. Eerste contact We bellen om het eerste gesprek in te plannen. Prangende vragen kun je dan al meteen stellen. In het ‘echt’ ontmoeten Dit eerste gesprek zien we als een kennismaking. We leren elkaar beter kennen en ontdekken of we goed bij elkaar passen. Het vervolggesprek Smaakt het naar meer? Dan gaan we in het tweede gesprek de inhoud in. Hiervoor vul je eerst een online assessment in met persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst, capaciteitentest en een case. Wij lichten de functie en het team toe. Wederzijdse liefde Twee gesprekken zijn vaak genoeg om een goed beeld te krijgen. En als onze liefde wederzijds is, dan begint jouw carrière bij bol.com. :) Nog vragen? Neem dan contact op met Leonie Havekes Recruiter lhavekes@bol.com

title: Data Analyst
description: Functie omschrijving Als Data Analyst bied je ondersteuning bij de groeiplannen van de organisatie. Er is een toenemende vraag naar de dienstverlening, maar deze groei moet wel op verantwoorde manier plaatsvinden. Met jouw inzichten en onderbouwing, help je de organisatie om de juiste keuzes te maken. In deze rol houd jij je o.a. bezig met het analyseren van verschillende data, maak je heldere rapportages en evalueer je verschillende projecten. Wat deze rol leuk maakt, is dat je echt mee kan denken met je collega's, om de dienstverlening nog beter te maken. Er zijn verschillende soorten analyses die uitgevoerd worden, denk aan het onderzoeken van een regio of gebied incl. het geven van advies, het analyseren van de afnemers, het evalueren van projecten met afnemers en meer. Het is een leuke en diverse job, waarmee je een tastbaar verschil maakt voor je collega's Bedrijfsprofiel Bijna 1000 medewerkers; Gezellige, informele en open organisatie; Pragmatische, daadkrachtige en hectische omgeving; Flexibele werktijden; Groeiende organisatie met concrete en tastbare plannen voor de toekomst. Functie eisen HBO werk- en denkniveau; Minimaal enkele jaren ervaring met data en marketing binnen de profit-sector; Affiniteit met afnemers en de manier waarop deze benadert worden; Analytisch- en communicatief vaardig, overzicht bewaren, gestructureerd, conceptueel denken en accuraat; Ervaring met SQL, denk aan het koppelen van informatie of het werken met datasets; Presentatievaardigheden voor kleine- en grote groepen; Hands-on mentaliteit. Arbeidsvoorwaarden Salaris 3500 - 4500 o.b.v. 40 uur, afhankelijk van ervaring o.a.; 20+7 vakantiedagen (opsparen voor sabbatical is mogelijk); 8% vakantiegeld; Resultaatafhankelijke uitkering van 3%; Persoonlijke prestatiebonus van 3%; 32, 36 of 40 uur per week; Collectieve ziektekostenverzekering, AOV en ongevallenverzekering; Reiskostenvergoeding 0,19ct per KM of NS Business Card; Mobiele telefoon en laptop; Persoonlijk budget van 15,17% (dit is inclusief vakantiegeld en de 7 vakantiedagen). Je kan dit inzetten voor bijvoorbeeld extra pensioen, aankopen extra verlof, fiets, etc.)

title: Local Trainer
description: Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 155,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s food ingredients and bio-industrial business, where we anticipate trends around taste, nutrition and safety to innovate and provide solutions to manufacturers, retailers and foodservice companies.  JOB PURPOSE AND IMPACT  The Business and Training Analyst II will be responsible for project management, coordination and continuous improvement for an assigned region or team. In this role, you will provide specialized knowledge within processes, systems and strategies. You will support the development and monitoring of key data to drive a positive customer experience, focused on accuracy, efficiency, productivity and internal controls and ensure teams have the knowledge to deliver excellent results.  KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES  Develop and deploy best practices across location and promote continuous improvement through consultation with teams.  Participate in project design, monitoring project progress, providing solutions to variances, handling project documents, developing communication and training plans, and delivering communication and training across the nation.  Maintain and update required analytical data.  Assist in the development and execution of a consistent and sustainable approach for onboarding and training on end to end administrative processes including necessary system functionality.  Ensure procedures, process maps and user guides are current, accurate and maintained.  Independently solve moderately complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating more complex issues to appropriate staff.  Other duties as assigned  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS  Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience  Confirmed data analysis skills  Knowledge of training systems and methodologies  Experience planning, monitoring and managing projects from initiation to completion  Experience anticipating issues, problem solving and implementing solutions and improving efficiency, quality, cost and productivity  Minimum of two years of related work experience  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS  Knowledge and direct experience with related database systems  Fluent in English and Dutch  OUR OFFER  In return for your expertise and commitment, we will provide a fast paced stimulating international environment, which will stretch your abilities and channel your talents. We also offer competitive salary and benefits combined with outstanding career development opportunities in one of the largest and most solid private companies in the world.  Interested? Then make sure to send us your CV and cover letter in English today.  Follow us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/cargill  Cargill is committed to being an inclusive employer. Click here to find out more https://careers.cargill.com/diversity/

title: Covid-19 Specialist Supervisor
description: Position Summary This role supports the management of case trends across Stryker sites including trending reports, potential training needs, communication with stakeholders and reviewing of escalated issues from Covid –19 Case Reviewers. Provides support to tier 1 reviewers and LIRTs on escalated cases. Serves as an expert in our personal exposure and response guidance and IRT process execution. Focused on the protection of employee safety and maintaining privacy in employee data. Supervises Covid Case Reviewers. Essential Duties & Responsibilities Meets daily with team/ Covid-19 team to review incident trends across sites Communication and direct interaction with employees and customers Confirmed positive phone calls Employee business travel and case management Support case reviewers with incident questions, protocol clarification, escalation, deep-dive related discussions Partnership with Medical team on escalated cases and response / quarantine guidance evolution Contribute to weekly LIRT communications: including email and content preparation Connection point with key stakeholders (Sites/ HR Operations and HRBP’s) Facilitate formal and adhoc trainings for LIRTs and Covid-19 team member(s) Function as a key contact for questions/concerns from HR leaders and LIRTs Analyze trends from the deep dive and site discovery discussions and provide exec summaries to SLT. Provide input to Covid –19 guidance in collaboration with SMEs and key stakeholders Alert to any potential HR or EHS policy changes that need to be made based on information coming out of the Covid –19 team Support the COVID Process Analyst on process change feedback and requirements Contribute to the Confluence knowledge base content People management; supervise a team of COVID case reviewers and provide support for incident overflow in the case of team capacity constraints or vacation coverage needs Education & Special Trainings Bachelor's degree, in any discipline Problem solver with creative approach to proactive identification and resolution of issues Execution-oriented, self-starter and self-navigator who can prioritize high-value projects versus tasks in a fast-paced environment and balance demands of multiple projects Very responsive, with a customer-centric/solutions-oriented approach and the ability to serve a wide range of needs within the organization and at all levels

title: Global Infra IT Analyst
description: Find what drives you on a team with a 70+ year history of being recognized for discovery, determination, and innovation. As a global leader in high-tech filtration, separation, and purification, Pall Corporation thrives on helping our customers protect people. Our portfolio is broad, so if your interests lie along the spectrum of Life Sciences to Industrial, you’ll find a rewarding role here. Our career opportunities are as diverse as our products and they are all focused on creating better lives and a better planet. At Pall, we believe that innovation is our legacy, our privilege, and our destiny. If that resonates with you, join us!  Goal of the Position: The IT Analyst deploys and supports hardware, network and telecommunications projects for Pall's Medemblik site. He/She develops, implements, supports network security policies and safeguards. Not only for the current infrastructure, but also to support the future needs of the site!  Key Responsibilities: Provide user and administrative support for desktop and local server systems; Provide technical guidance to users and management for desktop support and local server systems; Perform maintenance and troubleshooting of all relevant hardware and software; Implement and support network operating systems and services; Configure, install & deploy all PC’s and PC related peripherals; Maintain appropriate data backup and disaster recovery procedures; Develop a solid understanding of site's specific applications; Participate in projects or teams; Support project implementations and roll-outs; Recognise opportunities and recommend solutions for improving service, efficiency, and effectiveness; Contribute to meeting the departmental key performance indicators; 1st / 2nd level Customer Helpdesk support.  Education, Skills and Competencies: Up-to-date professional certification would be a plus; Experience of desktop support; Experience of network applications / operating systems / hardware; LAN / WAN fostering measures; Good Team-Player; Proficient in Dutch and English. #LI-KM1  Diversity & Inclusion  At Danaher, we are dedicated to building and sustaining a truly diverse and inclusive culture. These are not just words on a page—Diversity and Inclusion is a top priority for the company, and it ties deeply to each of our core values. Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law.  Pall Corporation is proud to be part of the Danaher global family of more than 20 operating companies, driving meaningful innovation in some of today’s most dynamic, growing industries. Danaher is a global science & technology innovator committed to helping our customers solve complex challenges and improve quality of life worldwide. Our world-class brands are leaders in some of the most demanding and attractive industries, including life sciences, medical diagnostics, dental, environmental and applied solutions. Our globally diverse team of 71,000 associates is united by a common culture and operating system, the Danaher Business System, which serves as our competitive advantage. We generated $19.9B in revenue last year. We are ranked #162 on the Fortune 500 and our stock has outperformed the S&P 500 by more than 5,200% over 25 years.  At Danaher, you can build a career in a way no other company can duplicate. Our brands allow us to offer dynamic careers across multiple industries. We're innovative, fast-paced, results-oriented, and we win. We need talented people to keep winning. Here you'll learn how DBS is used to shape strategy, focus execution, align our people, and create value for customers and shareholders. Come join our winning team. Danaher is committed to competitive compensation that typically has key components including base salary, variable annual incentive compensation based on personal and company performance, and long-term incentive. Equal Opportunity Employer  Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law. The “EEO is the Law” poster is available at: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf.

title: Senior BI Translator
description: Stel je eens voor… Stel je eens voor dat jij gaat werken in een zeer complexe data-omgeving, waarin klant-, markt- en stuurgegevens van zowel Rabobank als externe partijen zijn opgenomen. Een omgeving waar we inzicht leveren rondom alle speerpunten van de bank zoals digitalisatie, KYC (ken je klant) en bereikbaarheid voor zowel de centrale bank als de lokale banken. Een verantwoordelijkheid met impact, die je vormgeeft door als Informatie Analist cruciale informatieproducten te realiseren die bijdragen aan besluitvorming tot op het hoogste niveau van de bank. Daarbij kan je gebruik maken van innovatieve oplossingen die we binnen het team zelf ontwikkelen waarbij we voorop blijven lopen als bank.  Je gaat aan de gang binnen de digital transformation office. Een van de meest dynamische omgevingen binnen de Rabobank waar je vorm geeft aan de toekomst van de bank dicht tegen commercie aan. Het belang van data wordt breed binnen de bank erkent tot op groepsdirectie niveau en wordt gezien als cruciaal om het werk binnen de bank steeds slimmer te gaan doen. Daarnaast kom je te werken binnen een omgeving waar innovatie eerder regel is dan uitzondering en er wordt gewerkt met de nieuwste technologieën om waarde te creëren.  Impact creëren Ondersteunen van het Rabobank bij het inrichten van informatielevering en het gebruik hiervan. Analyseren van de daadwerkelijke informatiebehoefte en de achterliggende gebruik hiervan inclusief data analyse en kort cyclisch en incrementeel toewerken naar een product dat naadloos aansluit op de behoefte. Doen van een impact analyse van nieuwe verzoeken Borgen van het juiste gebruik van informatie en het uniformeren van definities Doet verbetervoorstellen voor processen en registratie van gegevens ten behoeve van het benodigde inzicht Coördinatie rondom projecten/epics waar je mee bezig is en gezamenlijk uitwerken van functionele requirements en business rules met de Subject Matter Expert (SME) vanuit de business. Opbouwen van relaties met stakeholders in de business waarvoor de informatie analist werkzaam is om gezamenlijk de toekomstige behoefte vorm te geven Maken van prototypes ter verfijning van de functionele requirements Realisatie van front-end producten in Power BI Met elkaar Samenwerken is de manier waarop we werken. Binnen de Rabobank is de Digital Transformation Office (DTO) het kloppend hart van alle digitale ontwikkelingen. Ons team Business Intelligence bundelt de krachten om de echte waarde uit klant, (digitale) klant processen & marktdata te halen en zet dit om in actionable insights. Hiermee verhogen wij de commercie, efficiency, 9+ klantbeleving en jagen wij de digitalisering aan. Met jou erbij als Senior informatie analist staat de teller van het team ruim 40 diverse collega’s waaronder: Theo, Senior informatie analist: 'Er zit ongelooflijk veel waarde in data! Als BI-translator help je de business om deze te verzilveren. Het is super gaaf als je ziet dat een opgeleverd BI product dagelijks wordt gebruikt en zo de dienstverlening van onze klanten continu verbetert.” Ferry, Senior informatie analist: “Wat interessant is in mijn functie als BI-translator is de afwisseling. Op het ene moment ben je met de ontwikkelaar aan het sparren over een technische oplossing en op het andere moment aan het meedenken met de business partners over oplossingen die wij vanuit BI kunnen bieden. Daartussen ben je ook een dashboard aan het ontwerpen wat je de volgende dag moet presenteren, het is nooit saai als BI-translator.' Met jouw talenten Natuurlijk ben jij klantgericht, nieuwsgierig, resultaat gericht en initieer jij verbeteringen. Juist die eigenschappen maken jou tot een goede informatie analist, zeker in combinatie met: Hbo/wo opleiding Minimaal 4 jaar recente ervaring in een informatie analyse rol binnen een BI team in een complexe organisatie Groot analytisch vermogen In staat structuur aan te brengen in een complexe en dynamische omgeving Goede netwerker/communicatief sterk Kennis van datawarehouses en BI concepten Je hebt kennis van SQL en bent in staat om data analyses te doen om tot goede inzichten te komen Kennis van de nieuwste ontwikkelingen met betrekking tot datavisualisatie en UX Ervaring met het werken in grotere teams in een agile setting is een pre Ervaring met Power BI is een pre  Bij de Rabobank Dat de Rabobank een financiële dienstverlener is voor meer dan 8,5 miljoen klanten in 40 landen, wist je vast al. Weet je ook dat we met elkaar werken aan een betere wereld? Dit doen we op 101 manieren, zoals: ‘Een derde van al ons voedsel verdwijnt in de prullenbak. Samen met Natuur & Milieu maken we consumenten bewust van hun voedselverspilling. ‘Rabobank is al sinds 2007 klimaatneutraal. We zetten ons elke dag in om een duurzamere leefomgeving te creëren. We stimuleren collega’s met het openbaar vervoer naar kantoor te komen en gebruiken groene energie.’ Wil jij dit ook? De beste versie van jezelf worden? Wij helpen je er graag bij door jouw ontwikkeling centraal te stellen en te investeren in een omgeving waarin je blijft leren. We geven je de ruimte om te innoveren en ondernemen. We bieden je volop groeikansen en helpen je verwachtingen te overtreffen en het goede buitengewoon goed te doen. Je kan hierdoor groeien als professional. Je kan bij ons (o.b.v. een 36-urige werkweek) ook rekenen op: Een bruto maandsalaris in schaal 9-10, afhankelijk van jouw kennis en exacte werkervaring; Een dertiende maand en vakantiegeld; Een Employee Benefit Budget (10% van je maandinkomen). Hoe jij dit budget inzet, is aan jou. Denk bijvoorbeeld aan het kopen van extra vakantiedagen of een extra storting in je pensioen; Flexibiliteit in werktijden en locatie-onafhankelijk werken; Een pensioenregeling waar je zelf maar 5% aan bijdraagt.  Laten we kennismaken. Ben jij onze nieuwe collega die de Rabobank wil versterken als Product Manager Data en zo het verschil wil maken voor jezelf, onze klanten én de maatschappij? We ontvangen graag jouw sollicitatie op deze vacature in Utrecht.  Handig om te weten: Solliciteren kan tot en met 31 januari, 2021. Reageer via de “Solliciteer nu” button. Hila Leupen-Turabaz, Senior Recruiter, beantwoordt met plezier vragen over de sollicitatieprocedure via mail hila.leupen-turabaz@rabobank.nl. Screening is onderdeel van de sollicitatieprocedure. We toetsen op basis van de screening procedures die binnen de Rabobank gelden of nieuwe medewerkers voldoende betrouwbaar zijn om werkzaamheden bij de Rabobank te verrichten. Wij willen jouw talent in de breedste zin van het woord inzetten en kijken graag breder naar jouw reactie dan deze vacature. Jouw profiel wordt meegenomen in de Sourcing Board Data & Analytics. Mocht je hier bezwaar tegen hebben dan kun je dit per mail aangeven bij Data.analytics@rabobank.nl. Jouw privacy is belangrijk voor ons. Mocht je hier meer over willen weten, klik dan deze link. Iedereen is anders, en juist de verschillen in mensen helpen ons om een nog betere bank te zijn. Daarom zijn we benieuwd naar wie jíj bent.

title: Data Engineer
description: Have you ever seen a pig with a smartphone? Are you the data engineer that will bring business intelligence in the stable? Do you want to contribute to innovation in our food production? Are you keen on working with others, and do you enjoy participating in our quest for the best solution? If so, we are looking for you! To give a better idea of what we’re doing: We have developed a product that determines the best composition of feed for cows. The software calculates this on a daily basis and our program instructs the feeding robot in the byre to ensure cows receive the proper feed. Watch this video (Dutch) to see the use of FeedProfitMonitor in practice. We help our farmers determine the most effective time of the week to protect their potatoes against diseases. Based on the farmer’s location, weather data from their own weather stations and Internet weather forecasts, our software establishes the best time to take action and protect crops. Watch this video (Dutch) to learn more about CropVision Gewis. With our Analytics reporting we bring figures to life to give pig famers an overview with all information they need. We bring data that the farmer entered using our app together with data from feeding stations, slaughter houses and breeding organisations to provide an overview in one central place. Watch this video (English) to see the use of the Operational Monitor in practise. Your responsibilities As Data Engineer you are responsible to gather and model data and make data available. Your primary task is to build and maintain an ETL-process to prepare data for reporting. Next to that, you assist your colleagues to create reports and overviews. You keep your knowledge up to date by following future developments in the data and business intelligence area. Your experience and knowledges enable you to bring solutions to a higher level. You like digging in complex problems and can use your analytical insight to find your way to a solution. You: Work and think at a Higher Professional Educational level; Have experience with data modelling; Knowledge of Datawarehouse architectures; Excellent SQL-skills; Experience with the Microsoft BI Stack (SSIS, SSAS) – certification is a pre; Are familiar with working with Visual Studio and version control (git); Excellent social and communicative skills; You are fluent in English; Flexible and pragmatic approach, a real team player. Where would you come for work? With us! We are a group of over 70 innovative developers, analysts and testers divided over three countries and working in 14 scrum teams. Together we create and develop software for the agricultural market. We support farmers by automating their working environment, ensuring their data exchange runs smoothly and providing them with smart devices and accurate reports to ensure optimum operations in their businesses. This mainly concerns dairy farmers, pig farmers and arable farmers (crops). Get to know us better via our company movie. Our offer We are offering a full-time position in an informal working environment and a challenging job in a rapidly developing sector. We believe in personal growth and development and focus on allowing you to develop by drawing up a personal development plan with you and providing you with the support and additional training required. We also periodically organise hackathons where you can work on your innovative ideas in an informal setting. Want to know more? If this is something that fires your enthusiasm and you are interested in joining our team, send your CV to hrm@agrovision.com  Unsolicited approaches with external candidates is not appreciated but we reserve the right to approach candidates whose CVs are forwarded.

title: Data Scientist, Experimentation
description: About us Beat is one of the most exciting companies to ever come out of the ride-hailing space. One city at a time, all across the globe we make transportation affordable, convenient, and safe for everyone. We also help hundreds of thousands of people earn extra income as drivers. Today we are the fastest-growing ride-hailing service in Latin America. But serving millions of rides every day pales in comparison to what lies ahead. Our plans for expansion are limitless. Our stellar engineering team operates across a number of European capitals where, right now, some of the world's most ambitious and talented engineers are changing how cities will move in the future. Beat is currently available in Greece, Peru, Chile, Colombia, Mexico and Argentina. About the role We're accepting these challenges by applying data, algorithms and machine learning to problems in logistics, routes, personalization, search, pricing, experimentation and more. Our Data Science team is at the heart of this effort and is an essential ingredient in Beat's aggressive growth plan and vision for the future.
